  4516                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4517                                  
  4518                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4519                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4520                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4521                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4522                                  ;
  4523                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4524                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4525                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4526                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4527                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4528                                  ;	  and a retf
  4529                                  
  4530                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4531                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4532                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4533                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4534                                  
  4535                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4536                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4537 00001763 [C800]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4538                                  
  4539                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4540                                  
  4541                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4542 00001765 2EFF36[6317]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4543                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4544 0000176A 2EFF36[E006]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4545 0000176F 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4546 00001770 CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4547                                  
  4548                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4549                                  
  4550 00001771 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4551                                  
  4552                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4553                                  
  4554                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4555                                  
  4556                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4557                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4558                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4559                                  
  4560                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4561                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4562                                  		;=============================================================
  4563                                  		;
  4564                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4565                                  		;
  4566                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4567                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4568                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4569                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4570                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4571                                  
  4572                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4573                                  		;=============================================================
  4574                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4575                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4576                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4577                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4578                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4579                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4580                                  
  4581                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4582                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4583                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs  
  4584                                  		
  4585 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4586                                  
  4587                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4588                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4589                                  		;push	ax
  4590                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4591                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4592                                  		;pop	ax
  4593                                  	
  4594                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4595                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4596                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4597                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4598                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4599                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4600                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4601                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4602                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4603                                  
  4604                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4605                                  
  4606                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4607                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4608                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4609                                  
  4610 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4611 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4612                                  
  4613                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4614                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4615                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4616                                  
  4617 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4618 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4619 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4620 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4621                                  
  4622                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4623                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4624                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4625                                  		; ds = cs
  4626 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4627 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4628                                  		; ds = 0
  4629                                  
  4630 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4631                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4632                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4633                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4634 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4635                                  next_int_:		
  4636 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4637 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4638                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4639 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4640 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4641 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4642 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4643 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4644                                  					; saving address in di
  4645                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4646                                  		;stosw
  4647                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4648                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4649                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4650 00001794 A5                      		movsw
  4651 00001795 A5                      		movsw
  4652                                  
  4653 00001796 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4654 00001798 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4655 0000179A 5F                      		pop	di
  4656 0000179B 59                      		pop	cx
  4657                                  
  4658                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4659                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4660                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4661                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4662                                  
  4663                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4664                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4665                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4666                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4667                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4668                                  
  4669                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4670 0000179C C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4671                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4672                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4673 000017A2 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4674                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4675 000017A6 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4676                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4677                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4678 000017AC 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4679                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4680 000017B0 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4681                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4682                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4683 000017B6 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4684                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4685                                  
  4686                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4687 000017BA 0E                      		push	cs
  4688 000017BB 1F                      		pop	ds
  4689                                  		
  4690 000017BC A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4691 000017BF A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4692 000017C2 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4693 000017C5 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4694                                  					; ;
  4695 000017C8 FB                      		sti
  4696 000017C9 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4697                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4698                                  
  4699                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4700                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4701                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4702                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4703                                  ;
  4704                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4705                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4706                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4707                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4708                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4709                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4710                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4711                                  
  4712                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4713                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4714                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4715                                  ;
  4716                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4717                                  ; to do anything special.
  4718                                  ;
  4719                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4720                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4721                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4722                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4723                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4724                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4725                                  
  4726                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4727 000017CB A801                    		test	al, 1
  4728                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4729 000017CD 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4730                                  
  4731                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4732                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4733                                  ;
  4734                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4735                                  ;
  4736                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4737                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4738                                  
  4739 000017CF 50                      		push	ax
  4740 000017D0 53                      		push	bx
  4741 000017D1 51                      		push	cx
  4742 000017D2 52                      		push	dx
  4743 000017D3 57                      		push	di
  4744 000017D4 06                      		push	es
  4745 000017D5 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4746 000017D7 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4747 000017D9 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4748                                  					; DL = drive number
  4749                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4750                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4751                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4752 000017DB 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4753                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4754                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4755                                  		; ds = cs
  4756 000017DD 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4757                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4758 000017E1 07                      		pop	es
  4759 000017E2 5F                      		pop	di
  4760 000017E3 5A                      		pop	dx
  4761 000017E4 59                      		pop	cx
  4762 000017E5 5B                      		pop	bx
  4763 000017E6 58                      		pop	ax
  4764 000017E7 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4765                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4766                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4767                                  
  4768                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4769                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4770                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4771                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4772 000017E9 A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4773 000017EC 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4774 000017EE 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4775                                  
  4776                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4777                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4778 000017F0 48                      		dec	ax
  4779 000017F1 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4780                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4781                                  
  4782                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4783                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4784 000017F3 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4785 000017F6 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4786                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4787                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4788                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4789 000017F9 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4790                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4791                                  
  4792                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4793 000017FB D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4794 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4795                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4796                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4797                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4798 000017FF 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4799 00001801 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4800 00001803 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4801                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4802                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4803                                  		; ds = cs
  4804 00001804 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4805                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4806                                  notsingle:				
  4807 00001808 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4808                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4809                                  					; booted off hard file
  4810 00001809 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4811                                  
  4812                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4813                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4814                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4815                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4816                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4817                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4818                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4819                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4820                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4821                                  
  4822                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4823                                  
  4824 0000180B F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4825 0000180E 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4826 00001810 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4827                                  gothrd:		
  4828                                  		; 07/10/2023			
  4829                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4830                                  		;			; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4831                                  		;			; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4832                                  		;			; ch = media byte
  4833                                  
  4834                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4835                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h (from MSLOAD)
  4836                                  		;cli
  4837                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4838                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  4839                                  		;sti
  4840                                  
  4841 00001812 51                      		push	cx ; *		; save number of floppies and media byte
  4842 00001813 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4843 00001815 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  4844                                  		
  4845                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4846                                  
  4847 00001816 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4848 00001818 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4849 0000181A 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4850 0000181C 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4851 0000181F 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4852                                  
  4853                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4854                                  		; ds = cs
  4855 00001821 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4856 00001825 A2[3E06]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4857                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4858                                  					; get/save model byte
  4859 00001828 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]
  4860 0000182C A2[3F06]                		mov	[secondary_model_byte], al
  4861                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  4862                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  4863 0000182F EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  4864                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4865                                  
  4866                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  4867 00001831 BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  4868 00001834 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  4869                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4870 00001836 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  4871 0000183A A2[3E06]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4872                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  4873                                  turn_timer_on:				
  4874 0000183D B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  4875 0000183F E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.

  5183                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of

  5187                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5188                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.

  5191                                  ;

  5193                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds

  5208                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5209                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5210                                  
  5211                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5212                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5213                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5214                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5215                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5216                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5217                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5218                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5256                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  5258 000019B8 7278                    		jc	short noparmsfromrom

  5260                                  ; if cmos is bad, it gives es,ax,bx,cx,dh,di=0. cy=0.
  5261                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  5262                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  5263                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic
  5264                                  ; diskette which need msbio,msdos to boot up before it sets cmos.
  5265                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.
  5266

  5269                                  		;mov	ch, 39		; rom gave wrong info.
  5270                                  		;mov	cl, 9		; let's default to 360k.
  5271                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5272 000019BF B90927                  		mov	cx, 2709h
  5273 000019C2 B601                    		mov	dh, 1
  5274                                  pfr_ok:

  5557                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5558                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5559                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5560                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5561                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.

  5574                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what

  5579                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5580                                  ;
  5581                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5582                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5583                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5584                                  ;use to start with.
  5585                                  ;
  5586                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5587                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5588                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5589                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5590                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.

  5668                                  
  5669                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5670                                  ;
  5671                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5672                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5673                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5674                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5675                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5676                                  ; off of it.
  5677                                  ;
  5678                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5679                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5680                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5681                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5682                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5683                                  
  5684                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5685                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5686                                  checkcompaqbug:

  5974                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================

  5976                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5977                                  ;
  5978                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5979                                  
  5980                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5981                                  
  5982                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5983                                  ; module name: remap
  5984                                  ;
  5985                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5986                                  ;
  5987                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5988                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5989                                  ;
  5990                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5991                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5992                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5993                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5994                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5995                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5996                                  
  5997                                  ; input:       none
  5998                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5999                                  ; exit error:  none
  6000                                  ; called from: msinit
  6001                                  ;
  6002                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6003                                  ;	  found in the system
  6004                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6005                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6006                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6007                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6008                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6009                                  ;
  6010                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6011                                  
  6012                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6013                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6014                                  
  6015                                  remap:		; proc near
  6016                                  
  6017                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6018                                  		; ds = cs
  6019                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6020 00001C69 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]
  6021                                  
  6022                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6023                                  
  6024                                  drive_loop:
  6025 00001C6D 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6026                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6027 00001C71 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6028 00001C73 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6029                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6030 00001C75 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1 ; 0FFFFh	; last bds?
  6031 00001C78 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6032 00001C7A EB49                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6033                                  
  6034                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6035                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6036                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6037                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6038                                  
  6039                                  fdrv_found:
  6040 00001C7C B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6041                                  fdrv_loop:
  6042 00001C7E 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6043 00001C81 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6044                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6045                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6046                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6047 00001C83 40                      		inc	ax
  6048 00001C84 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  6049 00001C87 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  6050                                  
  6051                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6052                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6053                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6054                                  ; any more.
  6055                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6056                                  
  6057                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6058                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6059 00001C89 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  6060 00001C8D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6061                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6062                                  		;mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6063 00001C8F 8A26[2501]              		mov	ah, [dsktnum]
  6064 00001C93 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6065                                  remap_loop1:
  6066 00001C96 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6067                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6068 00001C98 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6069 00001C9B FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6070 00001C9D FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  6071 00001C9F 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6072                                  
  6073                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6074                                  
  6075                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6076                                  		;mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6077 00001CA1 A0[CA16]                		mov	al, [drvfat]
  6078 00001CA4 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6079 00001CA6 721D                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6080                                  		;sub	al, [cs:dsktnum]
  6081 00001CA8 2A06[2501]              		sub	al, [dsktnum]	; is it one of the other floppies?
  6082 00001CAC 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6083                                  
  6084                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6085                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6086                                  
  6087 00001CAE 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6088 00001CB0 EB04                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6089                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6090                                  
  6091                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6092                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6093                                  
  6094                                  remap_boot_flop:
  6095                                  		;add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6096                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6097 00001CB2 0206[7500]              		add	al, [drvmax]
  6098                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6099                                  		;mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6100 00001CB6 A2[CA16]                		mov	[drvfat], al
  6101 00001CB9 FEC0                    		inc	al
  6102 00001CBB 1E                      		push	ds
  6103 00001CBC BF5204                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6104                                  		;mov	di, 544h	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6105                                  		;;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6106 00001CBF 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6107 00001CC1 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6108                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6109                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6110 00001CC4 1F                      		pop	ds ; ds = cs
  6111                                  rmap_exit:
  6112 00001CC5 C3                      		retn
  6113                                  
  6114                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6115                                  
  6116                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6117                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6118                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6119                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6120                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6121                                  ;**************************************************
  6122                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6123                                  ;
  6124                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6125                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6126                                  ;
  6127                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6128                                  ;**************************************************
  6129                                  
  6130                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6131                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6132                                  
  6133                                  getboot:	; proc near
  6134                                  
  6135                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6136                                  		; ds = cs
  6137                                  		
  6138                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6139                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6140                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6141                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6142                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6143                                  
  6144                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6145                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6146 00001CC6 A1[D516]                		mov	ax, [init_bootseg]
  6147 00001CC9 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6148                                  
  6149                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6150 00001CCB BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6151                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6152                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6153 00001CCE B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6154 00001CD1 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6155 00001CD3 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6156 00001CD6 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6157                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6158                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6159                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6160 00001CD8 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6161                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6162 00001CDA 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6163                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6164                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6165 00001CE1 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6166                                  erret:
  6167 00001CE3 F9                      		stc
  6168                                  norm_ret:
  6169 00001CE4 C3                      		retn
  6170                                  
  6171                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6172                                  
  6173                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6174                                  
  6175                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6176                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6177                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6178                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6179                                  ;   determine version number
  6180                                  ;
  6181                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6182                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6183                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6184                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6185                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6186                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6187                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6188                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6189                                  
  6190                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  6191 00001CE5 57                      		push	di
  6192 00001CE6 53                      		push	bx
  6193 00001CE7 1E                      		push	ds
  6194 00001CE8 06                      		push	es
  6195 00001CE9 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6196 00001CEC 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6197 00001CEF 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6198                                  					; fnon_removable
  6199 00001CF3 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6200                                  					; ffHardFile
  6201 00001CF7 C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6202 00001CFC 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6203 00001CFE 52                      		push	dx
  6204 00001CFF B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6205 00001D01 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6206                                  					; DL = drive number
  6207                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6208                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6209                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6210 00001D03 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6211 00001D05 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6212 00001D08 5A                      		pop	dx
  6213 00001D09 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6214 00001D0B 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6215 00001D0E 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6216 00001D11 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6217 00001D12 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  6218 00001D15 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6219 00001D16 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6220 00001D18 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6221                                  
  6222                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6223                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6224                                  
  6225                                  act_part:				
  6226 00001D1B 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6227 00001D20 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6228 00001D22 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6229 00001D26 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6230 00001D28 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6231 00001D2C 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6232 00001D2E 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6233 00001D32 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6234                                  got_good_act:				
  6235 00001D34 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6236 00001D36 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6237 00001D38 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6238                                  no_act:					
  6239 00001D3A 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6240 00001D3D 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6241                                  					; last entry done?
  6242 00001D41 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6243 00001D43 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6244                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6245                                  
  6246                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6247                                  
  6248                                  get_primary:				
  6249 00001D46 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6250 00001D4B 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6251                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6252 00001D4D 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6253 00001D51 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6254 00001D53 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6255 00001D57 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6256 00001D59 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6257 00001D5D 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6258                                  got_prim:				
  6259 00001D5F 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6260 00001D61 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6261 00001D63 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6262                                  not_prim:				
  6263 00001D65 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6264 00001D68 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6265 00001D6C 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6266                                  setret:					
  6267 00001D6E F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6268 00001D6F E9DC02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6269                                  
  6270                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6271                                  
  6272                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6273                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6274                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6275                                  ;
  6276                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6277                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6278                                  ;  without change.
  6279                                  ;
  6280                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6281                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6282                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6283                                  
  6284                                  set2:					
  6285 00001D72 2E8816[D716]            		mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6286                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6287 00001D77 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6288 00001D7B 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6289                                  
  6290                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6291                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6292                                  
  6293 00001D7F 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6294 00001D82 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6295 00001D85 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6296 00001D89 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6297 00001D8D 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6298 00001D8F 800E[D216]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6299                                  okdrive:				
  6300 00001D94 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6301 00001D98 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6302                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6303 00001D9B 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6304 00001D9F 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6305 00001DA2 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6306 00001DA6 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6307 00001DAA 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6308 00001DAD 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6309                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6310 00001DB0 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6311 00001DB3 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6312 00001DB5 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6313 00001DB8 72B4                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6314                                  okdrive_1:				
  6315 00001DBA 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6316 00001DBD 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6317 00001DC0 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6318                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6319 00001DC2 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6320 00001DC5 50                      		push	ax
  6321 00001DC6 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6322 00001DC8 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6323 00001DCA F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6324                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6325                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6326 00001DCC 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6327 00001DD0 58                      		pop	ax
  6328 00001DD1 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6329 00001DD3 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6330 00001DD5 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6331 00001DD7 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6332 00001DD9 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6333 00001DDC 50                      		push	ax
  6334 00001DDD 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6335 00001DDF 2EA1[2905]              		mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6336 00001DE3 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6337 00001DE5 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6338 00001DE9 58                      		pop	ax
  6339 00001DEA F7F3                    		div	bx		;  dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6340 00001DEC 2E833E[2905]00          		cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6341 00001DF2 777C                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6342 00001DF4 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6343 00001DF7 7777                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6344                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6345                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6346                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6347                                  okdrive_2:
  6348                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6349                                  ; dl is head.
  6350                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6351                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6352                                  
  6353                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6354                                  
  6355 00001DF9 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6356                                  					; check	for mini disk
  6357 00001DFD 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6358 00001DFF 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6359                                  					; set the physical track number
  6360                                  oknotmini:
  6361                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6362                                  				
  6363 00001E02 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two	bits of	cyl to high
  6364 00001E04 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6365 00001E06 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of	bits
  6366 00001E09 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits	to correct spot
  6367 00001E0B 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch is	cylinder (low 8	bits)
  6368                                  					; cl is	sector + 2 high	bits of	cylinder
  6369 00001E0D 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6370 00001E0F 2E8A16[D716]            		mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6371                                  
  6372                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6373                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6374                                  ; dh is head
  6375                                  ; dl is drive
  6376                                  
  6377                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6378                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6379                                  
  6380                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6381                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6382                                  
  6383 00001E14 0E                      		push	cs
  6384 00001E15 07                      		pop	es
  6385 00001E16 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6386                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot	sector
  6387                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6388 00001E19 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6389 00001E1C CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6390                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6391                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6392                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6393                                  
  6394                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6395                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6396                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6397                                  
  6398 00001E1E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
  6399 00001E21 53                      		push	bx
  6400 00001E22 50                      		push	ax
  6401 00001E23 2E803FE9                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6402 00001E27 740D                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6403 00001E29 2E803FEB                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6404 00001E2D 7529                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6405 00001E2F 2E807F0290              		cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6406 00001E34 7522                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record
  6407                                  check_1_ok:
  6408                                  		; 14/08/2023			
  6409 00001E36 BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB				
  6410                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6411                                  					; point	to the bpb in the boot record
  6412 00001E39 2E8A470A                		mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6413                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6414 00001E3D 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6415 00001E3F 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6416 00001E41 7515                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no,	invalid	boot record
  6417 00001E43 2E813F0002              		cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6418 00001E48 750E                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6419                                  
  6420                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6421 00001E4A 2E8A4702                		mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure	that
  6422                                  					; the sectorspercluster	is
  6423                                  					; a power of 2
  6424                                  					;
  6425                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6426                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6427 00001E4E 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it	zero?
  6428 00001E50 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6429                                  
  6430                                  ck_power_of_two:			
  6431 00001E52 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift	until first bit	emerges
  6432 00001E54 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6433 00001E56 7405                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6434                                  
  6435                                  invalid_boot_record:			
  6436 00001E58 58                      		pop	ax
  6437 00001E59 5B                      		pop	bx
  6438 00001E5A E93301                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6439                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6440                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6441                                  
  6442                                  valid_boot_record:			
  6443 00001E5D 58                      		pop	ax
  6444 00001E5E 5B                      		pop	bx
  6445                                  
  6446                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6447                                  
  6448 00001E5F 2E817F08322E            		cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6449                                  		;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  6450 00001E65 750F                    		jnz	short try5
  6451 00001E67 2E807F0A30              		cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6452                                  		;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  6453 00001E6C 7508                    		jnz	short try5
  6454 00001E6E EB2F                    		jmp	short copybpb
  6455                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6456                                  
  6457                                  setret_brdg:				
  6458 00001E70 E9FBFE                  		jmp	setret
  6459                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6460                                  
  6461                                  unknown3_0_j:				
  6462 00001E73 E91E01                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6463                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6465                                  
  6466                                  try5:					
  6467 00001E76 E8DA01                  		call	cover_fdisk_bug
  6468                                  
  6469                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature
  6470

  6494                                  copybpb:
  6495                                  
  6496                                  ; 03/10/2022
  6497                                  
  6498                                  ; we have a valid boot sector. use the bpb in it to build the
  6499                                  ; bpb in bios. it is assumed that only
  6500                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER
  6501                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_ROOTENTRIES, and
  6502                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERFAT
  6503                                  ; need to be set (all other values in already). fbigfat is also set.
  6504                                  
  6505                                  ; if it is non fat based system, then just copy the bpb from the boot sector
  6506                                  ; into the bpb in bds table, and also set the boot serial number, volume id,
  6507                                  ; and system id according to the boot record.
  6508                                  ; for the non_fat system, don't need to set the other value. so just do goodret.
  6509

  6618                                  ; ****** cas ---
  6619                                  ; IBM DOS 3.30 doesn't seem to mind that the TOTAL_SECTORS and

  6622                                  ; program. We haven't actually been COPYING the TOTAL_SECTORS
  6623                                  ; from the boot sector into the DPB anyway, we've just been using
  6624                                  ; it for calculating the fat size. Pretty scary, huh? For now,
  6625                                  ; we'll go ahead and copy it into the DPB, except in the case

  6682

  6685                                  ;Do not assume 1 reserved sector. Update the reserved sector field in BDS

  6818                                  
  6819                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is gauranteed
  6820                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6821                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6822                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  6823                                  
  6824 00001FD1 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; (12 bit fat)
  6825 00001FD3 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  6826 00001FD5 4B                      		dec	bx

  6828 00001FD8 D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; bx = 1+(bpb->maxsec+BDS.secperclus-1)/
  6829 00001FDA 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus
  6830 00001FDB 80E3FE                  		and	bl, 0FEh	; bx &= ~1; (=number of clusters)
  6831 00001FDE 89DE                    		mov	si, bx

  6834 00001FE4 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  6835 00001FE8 D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)
  6836 00001FEA 887D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bh	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]

  6843                                  dobig:					
  6844 00001FEF B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  6845 00001FF1 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  6846 00001FF2 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  6847 00001FF5 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6848 00001FF7 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  6849 00001FF9 5A                      		pop	dx
  6850 00001FFA 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  6851 00001FFD 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6852 00002000 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  6853                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  6854 00002003 B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  6855 00002005 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  6856                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  6857                                  
  6858                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6859                                  
  6860                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6861                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6862                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6863                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6864                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6865                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6866                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6867                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  6868                                  		
  6869 00002008 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+2
  6870 0000200A 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  6871 0000200D 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+1
  6872 00002010 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6873                                  
  6874                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  6875                                  
  6876 00002013 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  6877                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  6878 00002015 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6879                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  6880                                  
  6881                                  ; now, set the default filesys_id, volume label, serial number
  6882                                  
  6883                                  		;;mov	bl, ds:fbigfat

  6886                                  		;mov	bl, [fbigfat]
  6887                                  		;mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag

  6906                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to
  6907                                  ; see if (hidden sectors + total sectors) > a word. if it is true,
  6908                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  6909                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.
  6910                                  ; we don't do this for the bpb information from the boot record. we
  6911                                  ; are not going to change the bpb information from the boot record.

  7016                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  7017                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  7018                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  7019                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.

  7039 000020B3 268B451B                		mov	ax, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  7040

  7046                                  					; assume sectors per cyl. < 64k.

  7212                                  
  7213                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  7214                                  ;
  7215                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  7216                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  7217                                  ;
  7218                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  7219                                  ;
  7220                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  7221                                  ;   initialize it.
  7222                                  ;
  7223                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  7224                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  7225                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  7226                                  ;
  7227                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  7228                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  7229                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  7230                                  ;
  7231                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  7232                                  ;   save coding.
  7233                                  ;
  7234                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  7235                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  7236                                  ;
  7237                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  7238                                  ;
  7239                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  7240                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  7241                                  ;
  7242                                  ; called modules:
  7243                                  ;		  getboot
  7244                                  ;		  find_mini_partition (new), xinstall_bds (new), M038
  7245                                  ;
  7246                                  ;		  setmini (new, it will use set2 routine)
  7247                                  ;
  7248                                  ; variables used: end_of_bdsm
  7249                                  ;		  rom_minidisk_num
  7250                                  ;		  mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  7251                                  ;		  BDS_STRUC, start_bds
  7252                                  ;

  7254

  7256                                  domini:	
  7257 0000215E 8A36[5117]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  7258                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7259 00002162 20F6                    		and	dh, dh
  7260                                  		;cmp	dh, 0
  7261 00002164 7431                    		jz	short dominiret	; no hard file?	then exit.
  7262 00002166 B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  7263                                  domini_loop:

  7265 00002169 8816[5017]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  7266 0000216D B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  7267 0000216F CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7268                                  					; DL = drive number
  7269                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  7270                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  7271                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  7272 00002171 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  7273 00002173 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax

  7275 00002177 A3[5617]                		mov	[mini_hdlim], ax ; # of heads

  7282                                  					; initbootsegment:bootbias

  7284 0000218C E80900                  		call	find_mini_partition
  7285                                  domininext:

  7294                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
