 13492                                  
 13493                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13494                                  ;
 13495                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13496                                  ;
 13497                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13498                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13499                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13500                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13501                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13502                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13503                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13504                                  ;
 13505                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13506                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13507                                  ;
 13508                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13509                                  
 13510                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13511                                  HMAPtr:
 13512 000013BA 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13513                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13514 000013BF 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13515                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13516 000013C3 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13517 000013C6 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13518 000013C8 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13519                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13520 000013CD 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13521 000013CF FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13522                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13523 000013D3 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13524                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13525                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13526 000013D7 C3                      		retn
 13527                                  
 13528                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13529                                  
 13530                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13531                                  
 13532                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13533                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13534                                  
 13535                                  move_sector:
 13536                                  
 13537                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13538                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13539                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13540                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13541                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13542                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13543                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13544                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13545                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13546                                  ;
 13547                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13548                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13549                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13550                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13551                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13552                                  
 13553 000013D8 FC                      		cld
 13554 000013D9 51                      		push	cx
 13555 000013DA B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13556 000013DD 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13557 000013E1 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13558 000013E3 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13559 000013E7 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13560 000013E9 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13561 000013EB 59                      		pop	cx
 13562 000013EC C3                      		retn
 13563                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13564                                  
 13565                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13566 000013ED D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13567 000013EF F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13568 000013F1 59                      		pop	cx
 13569 000013F2 C3                      		retn
 13570                                  
 13571                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13572                                  
 13573                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13574                                  
 13575                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13576                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13577                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13578                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13579                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13580                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13581                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13582                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13583                                  ;
 13584                                  ; input conditions:
 13585                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13586                                  ;
 13587                                  ; output:
 13588                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13589                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13590                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13591                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13592                                  
 13593                                  check_wrap:	
 13594 000013F3 50                      		push	ax
 13595 000013F4 53                      		push	bx
 13596 000013F5 06                      		push	es
 13597 000013F6 57                      		push	di
 13598 000013F7 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13599 000013FA 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13600                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13601 000013FC 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13602                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13603 00001401 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13604 00001403 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13605 00001407 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13606 00001409 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13607 0000140C 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13608 0000140E 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13609 00001410 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13610                                  
 13611                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13612                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13613                                  
 13614 00001412 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13615 00001414 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13616                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13617 00001416 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13618 00001417 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13619                                  					; if on	boundary
 13620                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13621                                  not_on_bound:				
 13622 00001419 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13623 0000141C 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13624 0000141E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13625 00001420 40                      		inc	ax
 13626 00001421 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13627 00001423 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13628 00001426 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13629                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13630 0000142A 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13631 0000142C 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13632 0000142D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13633 0000142F 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13634 00001433 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13635                                  
 13636                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13637                                  
 13638 00001435 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13639 00001437 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13640 00001439 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13641                                  
 13642                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13643                                  
 13644 0000143B 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13645 0000143D 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13646 0000143F 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13647                                  no_head_bound:				
 13648 00001440 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13649 00001442 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13650 00001443 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13651 00001445 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13652 00001447 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13653 00001449 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13654 0000144C B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13655 0000144E 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13656 00001450 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13657 00001452 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13658 00001454 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13659 00001456 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13660 00001458 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13661 0000145A 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13662                                  no_wrap:				
 13663 0000145C F8                      		clc
 13664 0000145D 5F                      		pop	di
 13665 0000145E 07                      		pop	es
 13666 0000145F 5B                      		pop	bx
 13667 00001460 58                      		pop	ax
 13668 00001461 C3                      		retn
 13669                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13670                                  
 13671                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13672 00001462 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13673 00001464 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13674 00001466 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13675                                  
 13676                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13677                                  
 13678                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13679                                  
 13680                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13681                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13682                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13683                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13684                                  ;
 13685                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13686                                  
 13687                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13688                                  find_bds:	
 13689 00001468 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13690                                  fbds_1:					
 13691 0000146C 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13692 00001470 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13693 00001472 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13694                                  					; go to next bds
 13695 00001475 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13696 00001478 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13697 0000147A F9                      		stc
 13698                                  fdbs_2:					
 13699 0000147B C3                      		retn
 13700                                  
 13701                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13702                                  
 13703                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13704                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13705                                  doint:
 13706                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13707 0000147C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13708                                  					; get physical drive number
 13709                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13710                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13711                                  		
 13712 0000147F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13713 00001481 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13714 00001483 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13715                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13716 00001485 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13717                                  					; get request code
 13718                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13719 00001488 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13720                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13721 0000148B 9D                      		popf
 13722                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13723                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13724 0000148C 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13725                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13726                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13727 00001491 9C                      		pushf
 13728                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13729 00001492 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13730                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13731                                  dointdone:				
 13732 00001495 C3                      		retn
 13733                                  
 13734                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13735                                  
 13736                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13737                                  
 13738                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13739                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13740                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13741                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13742                                  ;
 13743                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13744                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13745                                  ;
 13746                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13747                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13748                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13749                                  
 13750                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13751                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13752                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13753                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13754                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13755                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13756                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13757                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13758                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13759                                  ;end struc
 13760                                  
 13761                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13762                                  
 13763                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13764                                  ;	ah = function
 13765                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13766                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13767                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13768                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13769                                  ;   output conditions:
 13770                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13771                                  
 13772                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13773                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13774                                  ;
 13775                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13776                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13777                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13778                                  
 13779                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13780                                  
 13781                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13782                                  
 13783 00001496 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13784                                  
 13785                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13786                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13787                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13788                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13789                                  
 13790                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13791                                  
 13792                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13793                                  
 13794                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13795                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13796                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13797                                  
 13798                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13799 0000149A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13800 0000149F 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13801 000014A1 53                      		push	bx
 13802 000014A2 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13803 000014A5 E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13804 000014A8 5B                      		pop	bx
 13805 000014A9 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13806                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13807                                  
 13808                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13809                                  
 13810                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13811                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13812                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13813                                  
 13814                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13815                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13816 000014AB 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13817 000014AD 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13818 000014AF 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13819 000014B0 51                      		push	cx
 13820 000014B1 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13821 000014B3 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13822 000014B5 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13823 000014B7 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13824 000014BB 59                      		pop	cx
 13825 000014BC 58                      		pop	ax
 13826 000014BD 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13827                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13828 000014BF 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13829 000014C0 06                      		push	es
 13830                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13831 000014C1 2EC41E[9614]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13832                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13833                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13834 000014C6 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13835 000014C8 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13836 000014CB 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13837                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13838                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13839 000014CF 07                      		pop	es
 13840 000014D0 5B                      		pop	bx
 13841 000014D1 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13842                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13843                                  
 13844                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13845                                  
 13846                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13847                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13848                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13849                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13850                                  
 13851                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13852 000014D3 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13853                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13854 000014D8 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13855 000014DA 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13856                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13857 000014DF 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13858                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13859 000014E1 50                      		push	ax
 13860 000014E2 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13861                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13862                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13863 000014E4 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13864                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13865                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13866 000014E9 58                      		pop	ax
 13867 000014EA EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13868                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13869                                  
 13870                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13871                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13872                                  
 13873                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13874                                  
 13875                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13876                                  
 13877                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13878                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13879                                  
 13880                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13881 000014EC 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13882                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13883                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13884 000014ED 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13885                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13886                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13887                                  
 13888                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13889                                  
 13890 000014F2 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13891 000014F5 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13892 000014F8 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13893                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13894                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13895 000014FA 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13896 000014FF 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13897                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13898                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13899                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13900 00001501 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13901                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13902                                  		
 13903 00001506 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13904                                  		
 13905 00001507 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13906                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13907 0000150C 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13908                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13909                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13910 0000150E 9D                      		popf
 13911 0000150F 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13912                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13913 00001511 1F                      		pop	ds
 13914 00001512 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13915                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13916                                  
 13917                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13918                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13919                                  ; a changeline error.
 13920                                  
 13921                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13922 00001515 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13923                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13924 00001517 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13925 0000151A 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13926 0000151C 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13927 0000151E 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13928 00001520 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13929 00001525 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13930                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13931                                  					; never	would
 13932 00001527 53                      		push	bx
 13933 00001528 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13934 0000152B E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13935 0000152E 5B                      		pop	bx
 13936                                  int13b:					
 13937 0000152F F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13938 00001530 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13939                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13940                                  
 13941                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13942                                  
 13943                                  goterr13:				
 13944 00001532 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13945 00001535 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13946                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13947 00001537 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13948 0000153A 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13949 0000153C 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13950 00001541 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13951                                  
 13952 00001543 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13953                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13954                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13955                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13956 00001548 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13957                                  
 13958 0000154A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13959                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13960                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13961 0000154C 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13962                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13963                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13964 00001551 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13965 00001554 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13966 00001556 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13967 00001558 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13968 0000155A 53                      		push	bx
 13969 0000155B 51                      		push	cx
 13970 0000155C 52                      		push	dx
 13971 0000155D A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13972                                  loop_ecc:				
 13973 00001560 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13974                                  
 13975                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13976                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13977                                  ;
 13978                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13979                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13980                                  ; track.
 13981                                  ;
 13982                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13983                                  ; this request.
 13984                                  ;
 13985                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13986                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13987                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13988                                  ;
 13989 00001563 E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13990                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13991                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13992 00001566 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13993                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13994 0000156B 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13995 0000156D 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13996 00001570 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13997 00001572 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13998 00001575 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13999                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14000                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14001                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14002 00001577 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14003                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14004                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14005                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14006                                  ok11_op:				
 14007 00001579 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14008 0000157D 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14009 0000157F FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14010                                  					; add 200h to address
 14011 00001581 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14012 00001583 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14013 00001585 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14014                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14015                                  
 14016                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14017                                  
 14018                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14019 00001587 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14020                                  ok11_exit:				
 14021 00001588 5A                      		pop	dx
 14022 00001589 59                      		pop	cx
 14023 0000158A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14024 0000158B EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14025                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14026                                  
 14027                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14028                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14029                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14030                                  
 14031                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14032 0000158D 06                      		push	es
 14033 0000158E 53                      		push	bx
 14034 0000158F BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14035 00001592 1E                      		push	ds
 14036 00001593 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14037 00001594 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14038                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14039                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14040 00001597 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14041                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14042 0000159C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14043 0000159D 07                      		pop	es
 14044 0000159E 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14045 000015A0 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14046 000015A3 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14047                                  
 14048                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14049                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14050                                  
 14051                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14052 000015A5 56                      		push	si
 14053 000015A6 57                      		push	di
 14054 000015A7 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14055 000015A9 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14056 000015AC E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 14057 000015AF 5F                      		pop	di
 14058 000015B0 5E                      		pop	si
 14059 000015B1 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14060                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14061                                  
 14062                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14063                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14064                                  
 14065                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14066 000015B3 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14067 000015B6 FB                      		sti
 14068 000015B7 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14069 000015BA 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14070                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14071                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14072 000015BC 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14073 000015BF 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14074 000015C1 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14075 000015C4 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14076 000015C6 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14077                                  
 14078                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14079                                  
 14080                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14081                                  
 14082 000015C8 52                      		push	dx
 14083 000015C9 51                      		push	cx
 14084 000015CA 53                      		push	bx
 14085 000015CB 50                      		push	ax
 14086 000015CC 55                      		push	bp
 14087 000015CD 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14088 000015CF 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14089 000015D1 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14090 000015D3 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14091 000015D5 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14092 000015D7 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14093 000015D9 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14094 000015DB 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14095                                  
 14096                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14097                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14098                                  
 14099 000015DF 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14100 000015E1 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14101                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14102                                  
 14103                                  no_skip_first:				
 14104 000015E4 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14105 000015E6 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14106 000015E8 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14107                                  
 14108                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14109                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14110                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14111                                  ;
 14112                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14113                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14114                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14115                                  ; in error.
 14116                                  
 14117 000015EA 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14118 000015EC 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14119                                  
 14120                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14121                                  
 14122 000015EE 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14123                                  					; set up head number
 14124 000015F1 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14125 000015F4 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14126                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14127                                  
 14128                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14129 000015F7 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14130 000015F9 F9                      		stc
 14131 000015FA E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14132                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14133                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14134                                  
 14135                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14136                                  
 14137                                  intverify:				
 14138 000015FD 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14139 000015FE 53                      		push	bx
 14140 000015FF 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14141 00001600 07                      		pop	es
 14142                                  dosimple:				
 14143 00001601 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14144                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14145                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14146                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14147 00001604 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14148                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14149 00001609 5B                      		pop	bx
 14150 0000160A 07                      		pop	es
 14151 0000160B E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14152                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14153                                  
 14154                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14155                                  
 14156                                  intformat:				
 14157 0000160E 06                      		push	es
 14158 0000160F 53                      		push	bx
 14159 00001610 56                      		push	si
 14160 00001611 57                      		push	di
 14161 00001612 1E                      		push	ds
 14162                                  
 14163                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14164                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14165                                  
 14166 00001613 06                      		push	es
 14167 00001614 1E                      		push	ds
 14168 00001615 07                      		pop	es
 14169 00001616 1F                      		pop	ds
 14170 00001617 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14171 00001619 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14172 0000161C E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14173 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 14174 00001620 5F                      		pop	di
 14175 00001621 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14176 00001622 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14177                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14178                                  
 14179                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14180                                  ; the first block.
 14181                                  ;
 14182                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14183                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14184                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14185                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14186                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14187                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14188                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14189                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14190                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14191                                  
 14192                                  doblock:
 14193                                  
 14194                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14195                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14196                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14197                                  				
 14198 00001624 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14199                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14200 00001627 51                      		push	cx
 14201 00001628 06                      		push	es
 14202 00001629 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14203                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14204 0000162A E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14205 0000162D 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14206                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14207 00001631 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14208                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14209 00001636 5F                      		pop	di
 14210 00001637 07                      		pop	es
 14211 00001638 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14212 0000163A 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14213 0000163C B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14214 0000163E 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14215                                  doblockflop:				
 14216 00001640 59                      		pop	cx
 14217                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14218 00001641 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14219 00001643 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14220 00001645 50                      		push	ax
 14221 00001646 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14222 00001648 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14223                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14224                                  
 14225                                  doblocklast:				
 14226 0000164A 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14227 0000164C 50                      		push	ax
 14228                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14229 0000164D E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14230 00001650 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14231 00001652 58                      		pop	ax
 14232 00001653 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14233                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14234 00001656 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14235 00001658 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14236 0000165A 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14237 0000165C 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14238 0000165E 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14239                                  					; then we are done already.
 14240 00001660 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14241                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14242 00001662 E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14243 00001665 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14244                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14245                                  
 14246                                  bufferx:				
 14247 00001667 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14248                                  					; set up head number
 14249                                  buffer:					
 14250 0000166A 53                      		push	bx
 14251 0000166B 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14252 0000166E 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14253 00001671 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14254                                  					
 14255                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14256                                  
 14257 00001673 06                      		push	es
 14258 00001674 1E                      		push	ds
 14259 00001675 56                      		push	si
 14260 00001676 57                      		push	di
 14261 00001677 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14262 00001678 06                      		push	es
 14263 00001679 1F                      		pop	ds
 14264 0000167A 07                      		pop	es
 14265 0000167B BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14266 0000167E 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14267 0000167F 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14268 00001681 E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14269 00001684 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14270                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14271 00001685 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14272 00001686 5E                      		pop	si
 14273 00001687 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14274                                  
 14275                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14276                                  
 14277 00001688 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14278                                  					; get drive number
 14279 0000168A 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14280 0000168D E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14281                                  					;
 14282                                  					; ah is	function
 14283                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14284                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14285                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14286                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14287                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14288 00001690 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14289 00001693 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14290 00001694 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14291 00001696 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14292                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14293                                  
 14294                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14295                                  
 14296                                  doread:					
 14297 00001698 06                      		push	es
 14298 00001699 53                      		push	bx
 14299 0000169A 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14300 0000169B 07                      		pop	es
 14301 0000169C BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14302 0000169F B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14303 000016A1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14304                                  					; get drive number
 14305 000016A4 E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14306                                  					; ah = function
 14307                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14308                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14309                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14310 000016A7 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14311 000016AA 5B                      		pop	bx
 14312 000016AB 07                      		pop	es
 14313 000016AC 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14314 000016AE 56                      		push	si
 14315 000016AF 57                      		push	di
 14316 000016B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14317 000016B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14318 000016B5 E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 14319 000016B8 5F                      		pop	di
 14320 000016B9 5E                      		pop	si
 14321                                  
 14322                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14323                                  
 14324                                  dotail:					
 14325 000016BA 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14326 000016BB 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14327 000016BE 41                      		inc	cx
 14328 000016BF 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14329 000016C2 F8                      		clc
 14330 000016C3 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14331 000016C5 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14332                                  
 14333                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14334                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14335                                  
 14336 000016C7 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14337 000016CA E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14338 000016CD E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14339                                  
 14340                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14341                                  
 14342                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14343                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14344                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14345                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14346                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14347                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14348                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14349                                  
 14350                                  bad13:					
 14351 000016D0 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14352 000016D2 5D                      		pop	bp
 14353 000016D3 5B                      		pop	bx
 14354 000016D4 5B                      		pop	bx
 14355 000016D5 59                      		pop	cx
 14356 000016D6 5A                      		pop	dx
 14357 000016D7 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14358 000016D9 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14359                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14360                                  
 14361                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14362 000016DC E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14363                                  
 14364                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14365                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14366                                  		;db 	0
 14367                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14368                                  
 14369                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14386                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14387                                  
 14388                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14389                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14390                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14391                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14392                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14393                                  
 14394                                  install_bds:		
 14395 000016EB 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14396 000016EC BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14397                                  
 14398                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14399                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14400                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14401 000016EF C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14402                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14403 000016F1 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14404 000016F5 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14405                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14406 000016F8 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14407 000016FA B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14408 000016FC 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14409                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14410 00001700 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14411 00001703 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14412                                  					; we don't own it
 14413 00001708 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14414                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14415 0000170B 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14416 0000170E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14417                                  next_bds:				
 14418 00001712 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14419                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14420 00001715 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14421 00001717 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14422                                  					; install bds
 14423 0000171A 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14424 0000171C 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14425                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14426 00001721 1F                      		pop	ds
 14427                                  
 14428                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14429                                  ;
 14430                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14431                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14432                                  ;
 14433                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14434                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]

 14436                                  ;
 14437                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14438                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14439                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14440                                  
 14441 00001722 C3                      		retn

 14534                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------
