 19513                                  
 19514                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19515                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19516                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19517                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19518                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19519                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19520                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19521                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19522                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19523                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19524                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19525                                  ;
 19526                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19527                                  
 19528                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19529                                  update_arena:
 19530 0000097F 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19531 00000980 57                      	push	di
 19532 00000981 51                      	push	cx
 19533 00000982 52                      	push	dx
 19534                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19535                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19536                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19537                                  	; ds = cs 
 19538 00000983 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19539 00000987 4F                      	dec	di
 19540 00000988 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19541                                  						;  before sysvar
 19542 00000989 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19543                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19544 0000098B 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19545 00000990 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19546 00000992 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19547                                  
 19548                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19549 00000994 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19550 00000999 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19551 0000099B 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19552 0000099D 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19553 0000099F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19554                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19555 000009A1 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19556                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19557 000009A5 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19558 000009AB 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19559                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19560 000009AD 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19561 000009B1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19562                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19563                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19564 000009B3 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19565 000009B6 5A                      	pop	dx
 19566 000009B7 59                      	pop	cx
 19567 000009B8 5F                      	pop	di
 19568 000009B9 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19569 000009BA C3                      	retn
 19570                                  ;
 19571                                  ; M012 : END
 19572                                  ;
 19573                                  FatalErr:

 19576 000009BD BA[8608]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 19577 000009C0 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 19578 000009C2 CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 19579                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 19580                                          ;jmp	stall
 19581                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19582 000009C4 FA                      	cli
 19583 000009C5 F4                      	hlt

 19591                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19592                                  ;
 19593                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19594                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19595                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19596                                  ;
 19597                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19598                                  ;
 19599                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19600                                  
 19601                                  AllocHMA:
 19602                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19603                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19604                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19605                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19606                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19607                                  
 19608                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19609                                  ;
 19610                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19611                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19612                                  ;	push	ax
 19613                                  ;	popf
 19614                                  ;	pushf
 19615                                  ;	pop	ax
 19616                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19617                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19618                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19619                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19620                                  
 19621                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19622                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19623                                  
 19624 000009C6 1E                      	push	ds
 19625                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19626                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19627                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19628 000009C7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19629 000009CA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19630                                  
 19631 000009CC E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19632 000009CF 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19633                                  
 19634 000009D1 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19635 000009D4 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19636                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19637                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19638                                  
 19639 000009D6 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19640                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19641 000009DA 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19642                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19643                                  
 19644 000009DE B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19645 000009E0 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19646                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19647 000009E3 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19648 000009E7 48                      	dec	ax
 19649 000009E8 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19650                                  
 19651                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19652                                  
 19653 000009EA B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19654 000009EC CD15                    	int	15h
 19655                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19656                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19657                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19658 000009EE 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19659                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19660                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19661 000009F1 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19662                                  allocHMA_1:
 19663 000009F3 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19664                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19665 000009F5 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19666 000009F9 48                      	dec	ax
 19667 000009FA 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19668                                  
 19669 000009FC E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19670 000009FF 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19671                                  
 19672 00000A01 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19673 00000A04 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19674 00000A06 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19675 00000A0D 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19676                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19677                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19678 00000A14 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19679                                  
 19680                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19681                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19682                                  ;	; cf=0
 19683                                  ;	;clc
 19684                                  ;	pop	ds
 19685                                  ;	retn
 19686                                  
 19687                                  grabhma_error:
 19688 00000A16 F9                      	stc
 19689                                  	; 11/12/022
 19690                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19691                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19692 00000A17 1F                      	pop	ds
 19693 00000A18 C3                      	retn

 19697                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 19698                                  ;
 19699                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 19700                                  ;
 19701                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 19702                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 19703                                  ;
 19704                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19705                                  
 19706                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 19707 00000A19 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 19708 00000A1C CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 19709                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 19710                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 19711 00000A1E 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 19712 00000A20 C3                      	retn

 19759                                  
 19760                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19761                                  ;
 19762                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19763                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19764                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19765                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19766                                  ;
 19767                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19768                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19769                                  ;
 19770                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19771                                  
 19772                                  StartVDHead:
 19773                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19774                                  
 19775 00000A3E 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19776 00000A42 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19777 00000A44 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19778 00000A46 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19779 00000A48 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19780                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19781 00000A49 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19782                                  VDiskSig1:
 19783 00000A50 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19784                                  
 19785                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19786                                  
 19787 00000A55 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19788                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19789 00000A5B 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19790 00000A6A 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19791 00000A6C 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19792                                  VDInt19:
 19793 00000A6D EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19794                                  OldVDInt19:
 19795 00000A6E 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19796                                  
 19797                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19798                                  
 19799                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19800 00000A72 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19801                                  VDiskSig2:
 19802 00000A75 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19803                                  
 19804                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19805                                  
 19806 00000A7A 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19807 00000A7D 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19808 00000A7F 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19809 00000A80 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19810 00000A82 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19811 00000A83 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19812 00000A85 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19813 00000A87 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19814 00000A88 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19815 00000A8A 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19816 00000A8C 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19817 00000A8E 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19818 00000A90 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19819                                  
 19820                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19821                                  
 19822                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19823                                  ;
 19824                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19825                                  ;
 19826                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19827                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19828                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19829                                  ;
 19830                                  ; Inputs : None
 19831                                  ;
 19832                                  ; Outputs : None
 19833                                  ;
 19834                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19835                                  ;
 19836                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19837                                  
 19838                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19839                                  
 19840                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19841 00000A92 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19842 00000A94 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19843                                  
 19844                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19845                                  
 19846                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19847 00000A96 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19848                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19849 00000A99 2EA3[6E0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19850 00000A9D A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19851                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19852 00000AA0 2EA3[700A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19853                                  
 19854                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19855                                  
 19856 00000AA4 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19857                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19858                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19859 00000AA6 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19860 00000AA9 CD21                    	int	21h
 19861                                  
 19862                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19863                                  
 19864 00000AAB 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19865 00000AAC 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19866                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19867 00000AAE 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19868                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19869 00000AB5 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19870 00000ABC 40                      	inc	ax
 19871 00000ABD 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19872                                  
 19873                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19874                                  
 19875 00000ABF FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19876                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19877 00000AC0 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19878 00000AC6 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19879                                  
 19880                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19881                                  
 19882                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19883 00000AC9 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19884 00000ACC BE[3E0A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19885 00000ACF 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19886 00000AD1 0E                      	push	cs
 19887 00000AD2 1F                      	pop	ds
 19888 00000AD3 FC                      	cld
 19889 00000AD4 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19890 00000AD6 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19891                                  
 19892                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19893                                  
 19894                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19895 00000AD7 57                      	push	di
 19896 00000AD8 06                      	push	es
 19897                                  
 19898 00000AD9 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19899 00000ADC 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19900 00000ADE BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 19901                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 19902 00000AE1 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 19903 00000AE4 BE[720A]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 19904 00000AE7 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 19905                                  
 19906 00000AE9 5F                      	pop	di
 19907 00000AEA 07                      	pop	es

 19914                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary

 19954                                  
 19955                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIt1.ASM)
 19956                                  
 19957                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19958                                  
 19959                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19960                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19961                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19962                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19963                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19964                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19965                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19966                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19967                                  ;								      ;I070
 19968                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19969                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19970                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19971                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19972                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19973                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19974                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19975                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19976                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19977                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19978                                  ;								      ;I070
 19979                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19980                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19981                                  
 19982                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19983                                  	; ds = cs
 19984                                  
 19985 00000B3C 06                      	push	es
 19986 00000B3D 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 19987 00000B3F 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 19988 00000B41 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19989 00000B43 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 19990 00000B45 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19991 00000B47 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19992 00000B49 05[1C0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 19993 00000B4C 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 19994                                  
 19995                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 19996                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19997                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 19998                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl

 20003                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl

 20007 00000B59 0E                      	push	cs

 20009 00000B5B BE[EC0A]                	mov	si,bmove

 20018                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20019                                  ;
 20020                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20021                                  ;
 20022                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20023                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20024                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20025                                  ;		the offset.
 20026                                  ;
 20027                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20028                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20029                                  ;
 20030                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20031                                  
 20032                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 20033 00000B64 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20034 00000B66 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 20035 00000B69 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20036 00000B6B 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 20037 00000B6E 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20038 00000B71 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20039 00000B73 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20040 00000B75 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20041 00000B77 1E                      	push	ds
 20042                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20043                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20044                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20045 00000B78 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20046 00000B7B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20047 00000B7D 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20048 00000B81 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20049 00000B86 1F                      	pop	ds
 20050 00000B87 C3                      	retn

 20057                                  ;		& INT 19 vector

 20094                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20095                                  ;
 20096                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20100 00000BB0 1E                      	push	ds
 20101 00000BB1 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20102 00000BB4 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20103                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20104                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20105 00000BB6 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20106 00000BB7 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20107 00000BB9 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20108 00000BBC BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20109                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20110 00000BBF B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20111 00000BC1 FC                      	cld
 20112 00000BC2 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20113 00000BC4 1F                      	pop	ds
 20114 00000BC5 C3                      	retn

 20978                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20979                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20980                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20981                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20982                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20983                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20984                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20985                                  ;
 20986                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20987                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20988                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20989                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20990                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20991                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20992                                  ;
 20993                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20994                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20995                                  ;
 20996                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20997                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20998                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20999                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21000                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21001                                  ;
 21002                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21003                                  ;
 21004                                  ;			  none.
 21005                                  
 21006                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21007                                  ;
 21008                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21009                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21010                                  
 21011                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21012

 21212                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21213                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21214                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21215                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21216                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21217                                  ;
 21218                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21219                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21220                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21221                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21222                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21223                                  ; program).
 21224                                  
 21225                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21226                                  
 21227                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21228                                  
 21229 00001039 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21230                                  
 21231                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21232                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21233                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21234                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21235                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21236                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21237                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21238                                  ; carridge return.
 21239                                  
 21240                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21241                                  ;character after =.
 21242                                  
 21243 0000103A 06                      	push	es
 21244 0000103B 1E                      	push	ds
 21245 0000103C 07                      	pop	es
 21246 0000103D 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21247 0000103E 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21248                                  
 21249 00001040 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21250 00001042 FC                      	cld
 21251 00001043 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21252 00001049 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21253                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21254 0000104C AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21255 0000104D 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21256 0000104F 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21257 00001051 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21258                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21259 00001053 AC                      	lodsb
 21260 00001054 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21261 00001057 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21262 00001059 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21263 0000105B FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21264 0000105D 47                      	inc	di
 21265 0000105E EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21266                                  done_installparm:
 21267 00001060 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21268 00001065 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21269 00001068 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21270 0000106A 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21271                                  					; starts with cr.
 21272                                  install_seg_set:
 21273 00001070 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21274 00001077 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21275                                  
 21276                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 21277                                  ;
 21278                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 21279                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 21280                                  ;
 21281                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 21282                                  ;
 21283                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 21284                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 21285                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 21286                                  ;
 21287                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21288                                  
 21289                                  ;;ifdef   MULTI_CONFIG
 21290                                  
 21291                                  ; If there's any environment data in "config_wrkseg", pass to app
 21292                                  
 21293                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21294                                          ;mov     cx,ax
 21295                                          ;cmp     word [cs:config_envlen],0
 21296                                          ;je      short no_envdata2
 21297                                          ;mov     cx,[cs:config_wrkseg]
 21298                                  ;no_envdata2:
 21299                                  ;;endif  ;MULTI_CONFIG
 21300                                  
 21301                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_environ],cx ; set the environment seg.
 21302                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21303                                  	;mov	[cs:iexec.environ],cx
 21304                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21305 00001079 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 21306                                  
 21307                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 21308 0000107D 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 21309                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21310 00001081 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21311                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21312 00001085 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21313 00001089 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 21314 0000108C 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 21315 00001090 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21316 00001092 B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 21317 00001094 BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 21318 00001097 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 21319 00001098 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 21320 00001099 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 21321                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 21322                                  
 21323                                  ;----------------------------------------
 21324                                  
 21325                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 21326                                  
 21327                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21328                                  
 21329                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 21330 0000109E 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 21331 0000109F 06                      	push	es

 21335 000010A3 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 21336

 21354 000010AF 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3

 21361                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21362                                  
 21363                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21364                                  ;
 21365                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21366                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21367                                  ;
 21368                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21369                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21370                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21371                                  
 21372                                  ParaRound:
 21373 000010B9 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21374 000010BC D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21375 000010BE D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21376 000010C0 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21377 000010C2 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21378 000010C4 C3                      	retn
 21379                                  
 21380                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21381                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21382                                  ;
 21383                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21384                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21385                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21386                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21387                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21388                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21389                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21390                                  ;
 21391                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21392                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21393                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21394                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21395                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21396                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21397                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21398                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21399                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21400                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21401                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21402                                  ;
 21403                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21404                                  
 21405                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21406                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21407                                  sysinit_base:				
 21408 000010C5 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21409 000010CA 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21410 000010CF CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21411 000010D1 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21412 000010D6 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21413 000010DB 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21414 000010DC 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21415 000010DD 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21416                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21417                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21418 000010DF E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21419 000010E2 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21420 000010E7 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21421                                  
 21422                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21423                                  
 21424 000010E9 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21425 000010EB 0E                      	push	cs
 21426 000010EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 21427 000010ED BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21428 000010F0 CD21                    	int	21h
 21429                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21430                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21431                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21432                                  _stall: 
 21433                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21434 000010F2 F4                      	hlt 
 21435                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21436                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21437 000010F3 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21438                                  
 21439                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21440 000010F5 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21441                                  
 21442                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21443                                  
 21444                                  sum_up:
 21445                                  
 21446                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21447                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21448                                  ;
 21449                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21450                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21451                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21452                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21453                                  ;
 21454                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21455                                  
 21456 000010FA 1E                      	push	ds
 21457                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21458                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21459 000010FB 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21460 000010FF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21461 00001101 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21462 00001103 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21463 00001105 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21464                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21465 0000110A D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21466 0000110C 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21467                                  sum1:
 21468 0000110E 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21469 00001110 46                      	inc	si
 21470 00001111 46                      	inc	si
 21471 00001112 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21472                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21473                                  sum_sys_code:
 21474                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21475 00001114 BE1411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21476                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21477                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21478                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21479                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21480                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21481                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21482                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21483 00001117 B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21484 0000111A 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21485 0000111C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21486                                  sum2:
 21487 0000111E 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21488 00001121 46                      	inc	si
 21489 00001122 46                      	inc	si
 21490 00001123 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21491 00001125 1F                      	pop	ds
 21492 00001126 C3                      	retn
 21493                                  
 21494                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21495                                  
 21496                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21497                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21498 00001127 0000                    	dw	0
 21499                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21500                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21501 00001129 0000                    	dw	0

 21515                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21516                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21517                                  ;
 21518                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21519                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21520                                  ;
 21521                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21522                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21523                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21524                                  ;
 21525                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21526                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21527                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21528                                  
 21529                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21530                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21531                                  
 21532                                  set_buffer:
 21533 00001146 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21534 00001148 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21535 0000114B 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21536 0000114D B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21537                                  set_buff_1:
 21538                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21539                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21540 0000114F 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21541                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21542 00001151 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21543                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21544 00001154 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21545                                  
 21546 00001159 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21547 0000115B 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21548 00001160 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21549                                  
 21550                                  ;	for each buffer
 21551                                  
 21552                                  nxt_buff:
 21553 00001161 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21554 00001164 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21555 00001166 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21556                                  
 21557 00001168 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 21558                                  
 21559 0000116D 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21560                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21561 0000116E 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21562 00001171 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21563                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21564                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21565 00001173 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 21566                                  
 21567 00001177 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 21568 00001179 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21569                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21570 0000117B C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21571 0000117F 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21572                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21573 00001183 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21574                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21575 00001188 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21576 0000118B 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21577                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21578 0000118F 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21579                                  set_buff_2:
 21580 00001192 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 21581                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 21582 00001197 2E800E[2E14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21584                                  	;retn
 21585                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21588                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21589                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21590                                  ;
 21591                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21592                                  ;
 21593                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21594                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21595                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21596                                  
 21597                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21598                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21599 000011A0 53                      	push	bx
 21600 000011A1 52                      	push	dx
 21601 000011A2 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21602 000011A6 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21603                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21604 000011AB 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21605                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21606                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21607                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21608 000011AE 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21609 000011B0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21610 000011B2 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21611                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21612 000011B5 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21613 000011B7 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21614 000011BA 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21615 000011BC BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21616                                  	;zf=1
 21617                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21618                                  	;zf=1
 21619 000011BF 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21620                                  got_hma:
 21621 000011C4 5A                      	pop	dx
 21622 000011C5 5B                      	pop	bx
 21623 000011C6 C3                      	retn
 21624

 21626                                  
 21627                                  set_buffer_info:
 21628                                  
 21629                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 21630                                  ;
 21631                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 21632                                  ;    ax = di
 21633                                  ;
 21634                                  ;out:
 21635                                  ;    above entries set.
 21636                                  
 21637                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21638 000011C7 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21639                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21640 000011CC 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21641 000011D0 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21642 000011D4 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21643                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21644 000011D9 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 21645                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 21646 000011DC 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21647                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21648 000011E2 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21649                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21650 000011E8 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 21651 000011EE C3                      	retn

 21653                                  ; ======================================================================
 21654                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21655                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21656                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21657                                  
 21658                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21659                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21660                                  ;
 21661                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21662                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21663                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21664                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21665                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21666                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21667                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21668                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21669                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21670                                  ;
 21671                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21672                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21673                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21674                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21675                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21676                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21677                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21678                                  ;	conditions:
 21679                                  ;
 21680                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21681                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21682                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21683                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21684                                  ;
 21685                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21686                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21687                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21688                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21689                                  ;
 21690                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21691                                  ;
 21692                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21693                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21694                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21695                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21696                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21697                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21698                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21699                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21700                                  ;
 21701                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21702                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21703                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21704                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21705                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21706                                  ;
 21707                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21708                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21709                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21710                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21711                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21712                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21713                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21714                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21715                                  ;
 21716                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21717                                  
 21718                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21719                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21720                                  
 21721                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21722                                  stackinit:
 21723 000011EF 50                      	push	ax
 21724 000011F0 1E                      	push	ds
 21725 000011F1 06                      	push	es
 21726 000011F2 53                      	push	bx
 21727 000011F3 51                      	push	cx
 21728 000011F4 52                      	push	dx
 21729 000011F5 57                      	push	di
 21730 000011F6 56                      	push	si
 21731 000011F7 55                      	push	bp
 21732                                  
 21733                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21734                                  
 21735                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21736                                  	; ds = cs
 21737 000011F8 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21738 000011FB 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21739                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21740                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21741                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21742 000011FD 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21743                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21744 00001201 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21745 00001204 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21746                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21747 00001208 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21748                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21749                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21750                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21751 0000120B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21752                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21753 0000120F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21754 00001211 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21755                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21756                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21757                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21758 00001214 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21759                                  
 21760                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21761                                  
 21762                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21763                                  
 21764                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21765                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21766                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21767 00001218 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21768                                  
 21769                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21770                                  
 21771 0000121D B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21772                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21773                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21774                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21775 00001220 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21776 00001222 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21777 00001224 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21778 00001228 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21779 0000122A 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21780                                  
 21781                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21782                                  
 21783 0000122D 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21784 00001232 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21785 00001236 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21786 00001238 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21787 0000123A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21788 0000123C 06                      	push	es
 21789 0000123D 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21790                                  
 21791                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21792                                  
 21793 0000123E 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21794 00001242 FC                      	cld
 21795 00001243 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21796                                  
 21797 00001245 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21798                                  
 21799                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21800                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21801                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21802                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21803                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 21804                                  
 21805                                  buildloop:
 21806                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21807                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 21808                                  	; 25/10/2022

 21815                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 21816 0000125A 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]

 21820 00001265 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21821                                  
 21822 00001268 E2DF                    	loop	buildloop
 21823                                  
 21824 0000126A 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21825 0000126D 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 21826 00001271 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 21827                                  
 21828 00001275 1E                      	push	ds
 21829 00001276 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 21830 00001279 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21831 0000127B 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ;convertible?

 21833 00001281 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 21834                                  
 21835 00001283 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable convertible nmis
 21836 00001285 E672                    	out	72h,al
 21837                                  
 21838                                  skip_disablenmis:
 21839 00001287 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21840 00001289 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			;es - segid of vector table at 0
 21841                                  					;ds - relocated stack code segment

 22553                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22554                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22555                                  
 22556                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22557                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22558                                  
 22559                                  new_init_loop:
 22560                                  
 22561                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22562                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22563                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22564                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22565                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22566                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22567                                  
 22568 000013E4 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22569 000013E7 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22570 000013E9 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22571 000013ED 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22572                                  
 22573 000013F0 1E                      	push	ds
 22574                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22575                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22576                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22577 000013F1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22578 000013F4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22579 000013F6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22580 000013F9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22581 000013FB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22582 000013FF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22583 00001402 1F                      	pop	ds
 22584                                  
 22585 00001403 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22586 00001406 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22587 0000140A C3                      	retn
 22588                                  
 22589                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22590                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22591                                  
 22592                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22593                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22594                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22595                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22596                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22597                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22598                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22599                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22600                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22601                                  
 22602                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22603                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22604                                  
 22605                                  setdevmark:
 22606                                  
 22607 0000140B 06                      	push	es
 22608 0000140C 51                      	push	cx
 22609                                  
 22610 0000140D 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22611 00001412 2E890E[2C14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22612 00001417 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22613                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22614                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22615 00001419 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22616 0000141D 41                      	inc	cx
 22617                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22618 0000141E 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22619                                  
 22620 00001423 59                      	pop	cx
 22621 00001424 07                      	pop	es
 22622 00001425 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22623 0000142A C3                      	retn
 22624

 22756                                  _$P_DBSP1	   equ	DB_SP_HI	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS blank
 22757                                  _$P_DBSP2	   equ	DB_SP_LO	;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS blank
 22758                                  _$P_Period	   equ	"."             ;AN020;
 22759                                  _$P_Slash	   equ	"/"             ;AN020;
 22760                                  _$P_Space	   equ	" "             ;AN000; SBCS blank

 22823                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22824                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22825                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22826                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22827                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22828                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22829                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22830                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS

 22832                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22833                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22834                                  
 22835                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22836                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22837 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX

 22848                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE

 22856                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22857                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
