 22861                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22862 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22863 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22864 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22865                                  endstruc
 22866                                  
 22867                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22868                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22869                                  ;
 22870                                  ;
 22871                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22872                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22873                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22874                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22875                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22876                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22877                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22878                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22879                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22880                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22881                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22882                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22883                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22884                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22885                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22886                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22887                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22888                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22889                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22890                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22891                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22892                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22893                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22894                                  ;	   :
 22895                                  ;
 22896                                  ;Note:
 22897                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22898                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22899                                  ;
 22900                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22901                                  ;
 22902                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22903                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22904                                  ;
 22905                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22906                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22907                                  ;
 22908                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22909                                  ;
 22910                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22911                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22912                                  ;
 22913                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22914                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22915                                  ;
 22916                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22917                                  ;
 22918                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22919                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22920                                  ;
 22921                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22922                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22923                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22924                                  ;
 22925                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22926                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22927                                  ;
 22928                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22929                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22930                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22931                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22932                                  
 22933                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22934                                  
 22935                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22936                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22937                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22938                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22939                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22940                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22941                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22942                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22943                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22944                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22945                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22946                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22947                                  
 22948                                  ;**** Function flags
 22949                                  
 22950                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22951                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22952                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22953                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22954                                  
 22955                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22956                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22957 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22958 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22959 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22960 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22961 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22962 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22963                                  endstruc
 22964                                  
 22965                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22966                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22967                                  ;
 22968                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22969                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22970                                  ;	     +-
 22971                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22972                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22973                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22974                                  ;	     |	:
 22975                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22976                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22977                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22978                                  ;	     |	:
 22979                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22980                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22981                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22982                                  ;	     +-	:
 22983                                  ;
 22984                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22985                                  ;
 22986                                  ;Note:
 22987                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22988                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22989                                  ;
 22990                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22991                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22992                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22993                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22994                                  
 22995                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22996                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22997                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22998                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22999                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23000                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23001                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23002                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23003                                  
 23004                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23005 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23006 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23007 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23008 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23009 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23010                                  endstruc
 23011                                  
 23012                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23013                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23014                                  ;
 23015                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23016                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23017                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23018                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23019                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23020                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23021                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23022                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23023                                  ;
 23024                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23025                                  ;
 23026                                  ;            +-
 23027                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23028                                  ;	    | or
 23029                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23030                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23031                                  ;	    | or
 23032                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23033                                  ;	    | or
 23034                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23035                                  ;	    | or
 23036                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23037                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23038                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23039                                  ;	    | or
 23040                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23041                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23042                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23043                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23044                                  ;	    +-
 23045                                  ;
 23046                                  ;
 23047                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23048                                  ;      list.
 23049                                  ;
 23050                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23051                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23052                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23053                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23054                                  
 23055                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23056                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk

 23059 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23060 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23061                                  endstruc

 23172                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 23173                                  ; ======================================================================
 23174                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23175                                  
 23176                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23177                                  ; SysParse;
 23178                                  ;
 23179                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23180                                  ;
 23181                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23182                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23183                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23184                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23185                                  ;
 23186                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23187                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23188                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23189                                  ;
 23190                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23191                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23192                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23193                                  ;
 23194                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23195                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23196                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23197                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23198                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23199                                  ;
 23200                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23201                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23202                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23203                                  ;
 23204                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23205                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23206                                  ;
 23207                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23208                                  ;
 23209                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23210                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23211                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23212                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23213                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23214                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23215                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23216                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23217                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23218                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23219                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23220                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23221                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23222                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23223                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23224                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23225                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23226                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23227                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23228                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23229                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23230                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23231                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23232                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23233                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23234                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23235                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23236                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23237                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23238                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23239                                  
 23240                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23241                                  
 23242                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23243                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23244                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23245                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23246                                  
 23247                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23248                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23249                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23250                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23251                                  ;
 23252                                  
 23253                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23254                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23255                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23256                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23257                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23258                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23259                                  
 23260                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23261                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23262                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23263                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23264                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23265                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23266                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23267                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23268                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23269                                  
 23270                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23271                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23272                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23273                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23274                                  ;	     segment.
 23275                                  
 23276                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 23277                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23278                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 23279                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 23280                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23281                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 23282                                  
 23283                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 23284                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 23285                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 23287

 23291

 23293                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove

 23296                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 23297                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 23298                                  
 23299                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 23300                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as

 23302                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 23303

 23380                                  ;M029 -- Begin changes
 23381                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23382                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 23383                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 23384                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23385                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23386                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 23387                                  
 23388                                  ;IF FileSW + DrvSW
 23389 000014FB 2EC706[CF14]5D5B        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char], ']['
 23390 00001502 2EC706[D114]3C7C        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+2], '<|'
 23391 00001509 2EC706[D314]2B3E        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+4], '+>'
 23392 00001510 2EC706[D514]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='
 23393                                  ;ENDIFtHHH

 23801                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23802                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23803                                  ;
 23804                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23805                                  ;
 23806                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23807                                  ;	    AL = type
 23808                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23809                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23810                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23811                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23812                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23813                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths

 24194                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24195                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24196                                  ;
 24197                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24198                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24199                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24200                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24201                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24202                                  ;
 24203                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24204                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24205                                  ;
 24206                                  ; Output:    None
 24207                                  ;
 24208                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24209                                  ;
 24210                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24211                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24212                                  
 24213                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24214                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24215                                  
 24216                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24217 000018CF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24218 000018D0 2E800E[4114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24219 000018D6 2E8026[4114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24220 000018DC 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24221 000018DF 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24222 000018E1 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24223                                  
 24224 000018E3 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24225 000018E5 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24226                                  
 24227 000018E7 2E800E[4114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24228                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24229 000018ED 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24230                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24231 000018EE E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24232 000018F1 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24233 000018F2 C3                      	retn
 24234                                  
 24235                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24236                                  
 24237                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24238                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 24239 000018F3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24240 000018F4 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;

 24242 000018F6 56                      	push	si			;AN000;

 24244 000018F9 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 24245 000018FB 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 24246                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 24247 000018FC 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24248 000018FF 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 24249 00001901 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 24250

 24252 00001906 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 24253                                  
 24254 00001908 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 24255 0000190A 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 24256 0000190C D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24257 0000190E D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24258 00001910 E8D100                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24259 00001913 722C                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24260                                  
 24261 00001915 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24262 00001917 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 24263 00001919 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 24264 0000191B D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24265 0000191D E8C400                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24266 00001920 721F                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24267                                  
 24268 00001922 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 24269 00001924 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24270 00001926 E8BB00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24271 00001929 7216                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24272

 24274 0000192D 11C1                    	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 24275 0000192F E8B200                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24276 00001932 720D                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24277                                  
 24278 00001934 01EA                    	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 24279 00001936 83D100                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24280 00001939 E8A800                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24281 0000193C 7203                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24282                                  
 24283 0000193E 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 24284 0000193F EBBB                    	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24285                                  ;
 24286                                  _$P_Value_Err0:				;AN000;
 24287 00001941 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24288 00001942 E98C00                  	jmp	_$P_Value_Err		;AN000; Bridge

 24431                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24432                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24433                                  ;
 24434                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24435                                  ;
 24436                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow

 24439                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24440                                  
 24441                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24442                                  _$P_Check_OVF:

 24445 000019EB 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24446                                  
 24447 000019ED 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24448 000019EE C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24449                                  
 24450                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24451 000019EF 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24452 000019F0 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24453                                  
 24454 000019F2 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24455 000019F3 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24456

 24458 000019F4 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24459 000019F5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25048                                  ;
 25049                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25050                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25051                                  ;	    blanks.
 25052                                  ;
 25053                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25054                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25055                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25056                                  ;
 25057                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25058                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25059                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25060                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25061                                  
 25062                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25063 00001C2B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25064 00001C2C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25065 00001C2D 2EC606[3B14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25066                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25067                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25068 00001C33 2E8026[4114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25069 00001C39 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25070 00001C3B 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25071                                  
 25072 00001C3D 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25073 00001C3F 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25074                                  
 25075 00001C41 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25076 00001C43 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25077                                  
 25078                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25079                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25080 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25081 00001C47 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25082                                  
 25083 00001C49 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 25084 00001C4C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25085                                  
 25086 00001C4E B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 25087 00001C50 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 25088 00001C51 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 25089 00001C53 EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25090                                  
 25091                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 25092 00001C55 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 25093                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 25094 00001C5A 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25095                                  
 25096                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 25097 00001C5C 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 25098                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 25099 00001C5E 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 25100                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25101 00001C62 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 25102 00001C64 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 25103                                  
 25104 00001C66 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 25105                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25106 00001C69 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25107 00001C6A 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 25108 00001C6D 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25109                                  
 25110 00001C6F E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 25111                                  
 25112                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 25113 00001C71 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 25114                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 25115                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 25116 00001C73 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25117 00001C74 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25118 00001C75 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25119                                  
 25120                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 25121 00001C76 2EA2[3B14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 25122 00001C7A 2EF606[4114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 25123 00001C80 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 25124                                  
 25125 00001C82 2E800E[4114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 25126                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 25127                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 25128 00001C88 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 25129 00001C8A EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25130                                  
 25131                                  
 25132                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25133                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25134                                  ;
 25135                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25136                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25137                                  ;
 25138                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25139                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25140                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25141                                  ;
 25142                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25143                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25144                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25145                                  
 25146                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25147                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25148                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25149                                  ;
 25150                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25151                                  
 25152                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25153                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25154                                  
 25155                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25156                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25157 00001C8C 8D2E[4A14]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25158                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25159 00001C90 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25160 00001C92 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25161                                  
 25162                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25163 00001C94 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25164 00001C96 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25165                                  
 25166 00001C98 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25167                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25168                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25169 00001C99 C3                      	retn
 25170                                  
 25171                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25172                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25173                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25174                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25175                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25176                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25177                                  
 25178                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25179                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25180 00001C9A 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25181 00001C9C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25182                                  
 25183 00001C9E 2E800E[4114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25184                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25185                                  
 25186                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25187                                  	; cf=0
 25188                                  	;retn
 25189                                  
 25190                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25191                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25192                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25193 00001CA4 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25194                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25195                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25196 00001CA5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25197                                  
 25198                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25199                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25200                                  ;
 25201                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25202                                  ;
 25203                                  ;  Input:
 25204                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25205                                  ;
 25206                                  ;  Output:
 25207                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25208                                  ;
 25209                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25210                                  ;
 25211                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25212                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25213                                  
 25214                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25215 00001CA6 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25216 00001CA7 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25217 00001CA8 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25218                                  	
 25219 00001CA9 2E833E[3E14]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25220 00001CAF 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25221                                  
 25222 00001CB1 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25223 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25224 00001CB3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25225 00001CB4 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25226 00001CB5 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25227 00001CB6 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25228 00001CB7 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25229 00001CB8 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25230 00001CBA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 25231 00001CBC B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25232 00001CBF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25233                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25234 00001CC1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25235 00001CC3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25236 00001CC5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25237 00001CC6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25238 00001CC7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25239 00001CC8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25240 00001CC9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25241 00001CCA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25242 00001CCB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25243 00001CCC 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25244                                  
 25245                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25246 00001CCE 2E8936[3C14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25247 00001CD3 2E891E[3E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25248                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25249 00001CD8 2E8B36[3C14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25250 00001CDD 2E8E1E[3E14]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25251                                  
 25252                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25253 00001CE2 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25254 00001CE5 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25255                                  
 25256 00001CE7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25257 00001CE9 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25258                                  
 25259 00001CEB 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25260 00001CEE 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25261                                  
 25262 00001CF0 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25263 00001CF1 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25264                                  
 25265                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25266 00001CF3 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25267 00001CF4 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25268                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25269 00001CF5 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25270                                  
 25271                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25272                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25273                                  	; cf=0
 25274                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25275                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25276 00001CF7 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25277 00001CF8 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25278 00001CF9 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25279 00001CFA C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25832                                  
 25833                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25834                                  
 25835                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25836                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25837                                  
 25838                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25839                                  ;
 25840                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25841                                  ;
 25842                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25843                                  ;
 25844                                  ;   Modification log:
 25845                                  ;
 25846                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25847                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25848                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25849                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25850                                  ;
 25851                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25852                                  ;
 25853                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25854                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25855                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25856                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25857                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25858                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25859                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25860                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25861                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25862                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25863                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25864                                  ;
 25865                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25866                                  
 25867                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25868                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25869                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25870                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25871                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25872                                  
 25873                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25874                                  
 25875                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25876                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25877                                  
 25878                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25879                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25880                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25881                                  
 25882                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25883                                  ;
 25884                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25885                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25886                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25887                                  ;	           line.
 25888                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25889                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25890                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25891                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25892                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25893                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25894                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25895                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25896                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25897                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25898                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25899                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25900                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25901                                  ;	           for details).
 25902                                  
 25903                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25904                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25905                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25906                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25907                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25908                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25909                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25910                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25911                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25912                                  
 25913                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25914                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25915                                  
 25916                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25917                                  
 25918                                  %endif
 25919                                  
 25920                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25921                                  
 25922                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 25923                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 25924                                  
 25925                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25926                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 25927                                  
 25928                                  		;public	DevEntry
 25929                                  
 25930 00001EDE 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25931 00001EE0 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25932 00001EE2 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25933 00001EE4 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25934 00001EE8 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25935                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25936                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25937                                  ;
 25938 00001EEC 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25939 00001EED 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25940 00001EEF 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25941 00001EF1 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25942                                  ;
 25943 00001EF3 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25944                                  ;
 25945 00001EF7 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25946 00001EF9 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25947                                  ;
 25948 00001EFB 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 25949                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25950 00001EFC 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25951                                  ;
 25952 00001EFE 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25953 00001EFF 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25954 00001F01 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 25955                                  ;
 25956 00001F09 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 25957 00001F0A 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 25958 00001F0C 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 25959 00001F10 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 25960                                  				; to use the file name in the command line

 26174                                  
 26175                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26176                                  %if 0
 26177                                  
 26178                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26179                                  
 26180                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26181                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26182                                  
 26183                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26184                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26185                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26186                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26187                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26188                                  
 26189                                          push    ax                      ;
 26190                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26191                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26192                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26193                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26194                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26195                                          pop     ax
 26196                                  ;
 26197                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26198                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26199                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26200                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26201                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26202                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26203                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26204                                  ;   spot.
 26205                                  ;
 26206                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26207                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26208                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26209                                  ;   retrieved.
 26210                                  ;
 26211                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26212                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26213                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26214                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26215                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26216                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26217                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26218                                  final:                                  ;
 26219                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26220                                  not_final:                              ;
 26221                                  ;endif
 26222                                  
 26223                                  %endif

 26272 0000200D 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26273                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26274                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26275                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26276                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26277                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26278                                  					; and before install= commands
 26279                                  					; are processed
 26280

 26282 00002014 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26283 00002016 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26284                                  	; 11/12/2022

 26286 00002019 74D9                    	je	short coff

 26288                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26289                                  
 26290                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26291                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26292                                          
 26293 0000201B 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26294                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26295                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26296 0000201E 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 26297                                  	
 26298                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26299 00002020 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26300                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26301 00002025 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26302                                  
 26303                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26304                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 26305                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26306                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing

 26309                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 26310

 26312 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 26313                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 26314                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26315 0000202A 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 26316

 26318                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 26321                                  ;;endif

 26324 0000202F EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26325

 26327                                  %if 0
 26328                                  
 26329                                  multi_try_n:
 26330                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26331                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26332                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26333                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26334                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26335                                  ;endif

 26337                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26338                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26339

 26341                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy

 26343                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26344                                  
 26345                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26346                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26347                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26348                                  
 26349                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26350                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26351                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26352                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26353                                  
 26354                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26355                                  	mov	bx,1
 26356                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26357                                  
 26358                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26359                                  
 26360                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26361                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26362                                          int     21h
 26363                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26364                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26365                                          int     21h
 26366                                  
 26367                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26368                                  
 26369                                  %endif
 26370                                  
 26371                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26372 00002031 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 26373 00002034 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26374 00002036 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 26375 00002039 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26376 0000203B 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 26377 0000203E 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 26378                                  
 26379                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26380 00002040 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 26381 00002044 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 26382                                  
 26383                                  multi_pass_coff:
 26384                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26385 00002048 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.

 26387                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26388                                  ; buffer command
 26389                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26390                                  
 26391                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26392                                  ;									      *
 26393                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26394                                  ;									      *
 26395                                  ; input :								      *
 26396                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26397                                  ; output:								      *
 26398                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26399                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26400                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26401                                  ;									      *
 26402                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26403                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26404                                  ; logic:								      *
 26405                                  ; {									      *
 26406                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26407                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26408                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26409                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26410                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26411                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26412                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26413                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26414                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26415                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26416                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26417                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26418                                  ;	};								      *
 26419                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26420                                  ; };									      *
 26421                                  ;									      *
 26422                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26423                                  
 26424                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26425                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26426                                  tryb:
 26427 0000204A 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26428 0000204D 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26429                                  
 26430                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26431                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26432                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26433                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26434                                  ;;endif
 26435                                  
 26436                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 26511                                  ; break command
 26512                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26513                                  
 26514                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26515                                  ;									    *
 26516                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26517                                  ;									    *
 26518                                  ; input :								    *
 26519                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26520                                  ; output:								    *
 26521                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26522                                  ;									    *
 26523                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26524                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
