 26529                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26530                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26531                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26532                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *

 26534                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26535                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *

 26537                                  ;	};								    *

 26539                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 26540                                  ; };									    *
 26541                                  ;									    *
 26542                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26543                                  
 26544                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26545                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)

 26548 000020A9 7534                    	jne	short trym
 26549

 26551                                  ;;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG

 26553                                  ;       jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26554                                  ;;endif

 26556 000020AE 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx

 26559                                  do22:

 26561 000020B3 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 26562                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 26563                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 26564                                  	; 31/12/2022

 26566                                  	;jmp	coff
 26567                                  	; 04/01/2023

 26570 000020B8 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?

 26572

 27938                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27939                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27940                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27941                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27942                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27943                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27944                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27945                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27946                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27947                                  
 27948                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27949                                  ;									  *
 27950                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27951                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27952                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27953                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27954                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27955                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27956                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27957                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27958                                  ; input :								  *
 27959                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27960                                  ; output:								  *
 27961                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27962                                  ;									  *
 27963                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27964                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27965                                  ; logic:								  *
 27966                                  ; {									  *
 27967                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27968                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27969                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27970                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27971                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27972                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27973                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27974                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27975                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27976                                  ;	     }								  *
 27977                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27978                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27979                                  ;	};								  *
 27980                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27981                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27982                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27983                                  ; };									  *
 27984                                  ;**************************************************************************

 28654                                  
 28655                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28656                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28657                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28658                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28659                                  ;
 28660                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28661                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28662                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28663                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28664                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28665                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28666                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28667                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28668                                  ;	 procedure.
 28669                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28670                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28671                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28672                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 28917 00002756 A1[2B03]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 28918                                  sln_loop:
 28919                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28920 00002759 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; < 10 ?
 28921                                  	;cmp	ax,10		; < 10?
 28922 0000275B 720C                    	jb	short sln_last
 28923                                  
 28924 0000275D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 28925 0000275F F7F1                    	div	cx	; cx = 10
 28926 00002761 80CA30                  	or	dl,30h		; add "0" (= 30h) to make it an ascii.
 28927 00002764 8815                    	mov	[di],dl
 28928 00002766 4F                      	dec	di
 28929 00002767 EBF0                    	jmp	short sln_loop
 28930                                  
 28931                                  sln_last:

 28933 0000276B 8805                    	mov	[di],al
 28934 0000276D 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28935 0000276F E8090C                  	call	print		; show it.
 28936 00002772 5F                      	pop	di
 28937                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28938                                  	;pop	ds
 28939 00002773 07                      	pop	es
 28940 00002774 C3                      	retn

 28998                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28999                                  ;
 29000                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29001                                  ;
 29002                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29003                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29004                                  ;
 29005                                  ;	Output : none
 29006                                  ;
 29007                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29008                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29009                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29010                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29011                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29012                                  ;
 29013                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29014                                  
 29015                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29016                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29017                                  	; ds = cs
 29018 00002798 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29019                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29020                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29021 0000279B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29022 0000279E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29023                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29024                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29025                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29026                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29027                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29028                                  	; ds = cs
 29029 000027A0 803E[FB1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29030 000027A5 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29031 000027A7 A1[E21E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29032                                  lim_set:
 29033                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29034                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29035                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29036                                  ;limx:
 29037                                  	;retn
 29038                                  	
 29039                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29040                                  
 29041                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29042                                  ;
 29043                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29044                                  ;
 29045                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29046                                  ;	Output : none
 29047                                  ;
 29048                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29049                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29050                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29051                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29052                                  ;
 29053                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29054                                  
 29055                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29056                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29057 000027AA 1E                      	push	ds
 29058 000027AB BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29059 000027AE 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29060 000027B0 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29061 000027B4 2E891E[FF1E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29062 000027B9 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29063 000027BB D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29064 000027BD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29065 000027C0 2EC606[FE1E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29066 000027C6 1F                      	pop	ds
 29067                                  ;limx:
 29068 000027C7 C3                      	retn
 29069                                  
 29070                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29071                                  ;
 29072                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29073                                  ;
 29074                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29075                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29076                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29077                                  ;
 29078                                  ;	Output : none
 29079                                  ;
 29080                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29081                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29082                                  ;
 29083                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29084                                  
 29085                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29086                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29087                                  	; ds = cs
 29088 000027C8 803E[FE1E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29089                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29090                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29091                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29092 000027CD 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29093                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29094 000027CF B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29095 000027D2 8826[FE1E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29096                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29097                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29098 000027D6 1E                      	push	ds
 29099                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29100 000027D7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29101 000027D9 2EA1[FF1E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29102 000027DD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29103 000027E0 1F                      	pop	ds
 29104                                  timx:
 29105 000027E1 C3                      	retn
 29106

 29127 000027EC 0E                      	push	cs
 29128 000027ED 07                      	pop	es

 29154                                  
 29155                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29156                                  
 29157                                  %if 0
 29158                                  
 29159                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29160                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29161                                  
 29162                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29163                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29164                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29165                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29166                                  
 29167                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29168                                  ;
 29169                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29170                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29171                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29172                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29173                                  ;
 29174                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29175                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29176                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29177                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29178                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29179                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29180                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29181                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29182                                  ; available during the load.
 29183                                  ;
 29184                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29185                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29186                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29187                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29188                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29189                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29190                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29191                                  ;
 29192                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29193                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29194                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29195                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29196                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29197                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29198                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29199                                  ;
 29200                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29201                                  
 29202                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29203                                  
 29204                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29205                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29206                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29207                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29208                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29209                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29210                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29211                                  
 29212                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29213                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29214                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29215                                  
 29216                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29217                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29218                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29219                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29220                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29221                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29222                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29223                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29224                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29225                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29226                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29227                                  
 29228                                  InitVar:
 29229                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29230                                  	push	ax
 29231                                  	push	cx
 29232                                  	push	di
 29233                                  	push	es
 29234                                  
 29235                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29236                                  	push	cs
 29237                                  	pop	es
 29238                                  
 29239                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29240                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29241                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29242                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29243                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29244                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29245                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29246                                  
 29247                                  	cld
 29248                                  
 29249                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29250                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29251                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29252                                  
 29253                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29254                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29255                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29256                                  
 29257                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29258                                  
 29259                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29260                                  	pop	es
 29261                                  	pop	di
 29262                                  	pop	cx
 29263                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29264                                  
 29265                                  	retn
 29266                                  
 29267                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29268                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29269                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29270                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29271                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29272                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29273                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29274                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29275                                  
 29276                                  FixMem:
 29277                                  	push	ax
 29278                                  	push	bx
 29279                                  	push	cx
 29280                                  	push	dx
 29281                                  	push	es
 29282                                  
 29283                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29284                                  
 29285                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29286                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29287                                  
 29288                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29289                                  
 29290                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29291                                  
 29292                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29293                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29294                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29295                                  
 29296                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29297                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29298                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29299                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29300                                  
 29301                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29302                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29303                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29304                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29305                                  
 29306                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29307                                  
 29308                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29309                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29310                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29311                                  
 29312                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29313                                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29314                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29315                                  
 29316                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29317                                  
 29318                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29319                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29320                                  
 29321                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29322                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29323                                  	inc	bx
 29324                                  	mov	es,bx
 29325                                  
 29326                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29327                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29328                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29329                                  fmX:	
 29330                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29331                                  
 29332                                  	pop	es
 29333                                  	pop	dx
 29334                                  	pop	cx
 29335                                  	pop	bx
 29336                                  	pop	ax
 29337                                  
 29338                                  	retn
 29339                                  
 29340                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29341                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29342                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29343                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29344                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29345                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29346                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29347                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29348                                  
 29349                                  fm_link:
 29350                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29351                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29352                                  
 29353                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29354                                  	;
 29355                                  	;push	es
 29356                                  	;push	cs
 29357                                  	;pop	es
 29358                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29359                                  	;pop	es
 29360                                  	
 29361                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29362                                  
 29363                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29364                                  	mov	bx,1
 29365                                  	int	21h
 29366                                  	retn
 29367                                  
 29368                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29369                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29370                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29371                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29372                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29373                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29374                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29375                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29376                                  
 29377                                  fm_unlink:
 29378                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29379                                  	
 29380                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29381                                  	;
 29382                                  	;push	ds
 29383                                  	;push	cs
 29384                                  	;pop	ds
 29385                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29386                                  	;pop	ds
 29387                                  	
 29388                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29389                                  
 29390                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29391                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29392                                  	retn
 29393                                  
 29394                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29395                                  
 29396                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29397                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29398                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29399                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29400                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29401                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29402                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29403                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29404                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29405                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29406                                  ;
 29407                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29408                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29409                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29410                                  ;
 29411                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29412                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29413                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29414                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29415                                  ;
 29416                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29417                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29418                                  ;
 29419                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29420                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29421                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29422                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29423                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29424                                  ;     lh
 29425                                  ;     /l
 29426                                  ;     1
 29427                                  ;     1000
 29428                                  ;     2
 29429                                  ;     print
 29430                                  ;     /d
 29431                                  ;     :lpt2
 29432                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29433                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29434                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29435                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29436                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29437                                  ; for:
 29438                                  ;    Each /L
 29439                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29440                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29441                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29442                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29443                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29444                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29445                                  
 29446                                  ParseVar:
 29447                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29448                                  	push	di
 29449                                  	push	ds
 29450                                  	push	es
 29451                                  
 29452                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29453                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29454                                  	cld
 29455                                  
 29456                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29457                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29458                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29459                                  
 29460                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29461                                  	call	isWhite
 29462                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29463                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29464                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29465                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29466                                  
 29467                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29468                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29469                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29470                                  
 29471                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29472                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29473                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29474                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29475                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29476                                  	jne	short pv30
 29477                                  
 29478                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29479                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29480                                  
 29481                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29482                                  	;
 29483                                  	;push	es
 29484                                  	;push	cs
 29485                                  	;pop	es
 29486                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29487                                  	;pop	es
 29488                                  
 29489                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29490                                  
 29491                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29492                                  
 29493                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29494                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29495                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29496                                  
 29497                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29498                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29499                                  
 29500                                  	call	parseL
 29501                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29502                                  
 29503                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29504                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29505                                  
 29506                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29507                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29508                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29509                                  	dec	si
 29510                                  	stc
 29511                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29512                                  	pop	es
 29513                                  	pop	ds
 29514                                  	pop	di
 29515                                  	retn
 29516                                  
 29517                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29518                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29519                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29520                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29521                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29522                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29523                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29524                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29525                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29526                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29527                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29528                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29529                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29530                                  
 29531                                  parseL:
 29532                                  	lodsb
 29533                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29534                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29535                                  
 29536                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29537                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29538                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29539                                  
 29540                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29541                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29542                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29543                                  
 29544                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29545                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29546                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29547                                  
 29548                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29549                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29550                                  
 29551                                  	lodsb
 29552                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29553                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29554                                  
 29555                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29556                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29557                                  
 29558                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29559                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29560                                  
 29561                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29562                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29563                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29564                                  
 29565                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29566                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29567                                  
 29568                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29569                                  
 29570                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29571                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29572                                  
 29573                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29574                                  
 29575                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29576                                  
 29577                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29578                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29579                                  
 29580                                  	lodsb
 29581                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29582                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29583                                  
 29584                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29585                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29586                                  
 29587                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29588                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29589                                  
 29590                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29591                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29592                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29593                                  plE1:	
 29594                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29595                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29596                                  	dec	si
 29597                                  	stc
 29598                                  	retn
 29599                                  
 29600                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29601                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29602                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29603                                  	; cf=1
 29604                                  	;stc
 29605                                  	retn
 29606                                  plSwX:	
 29607                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29608                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29609                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29610                                  	; cf=0
 29611                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29612                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29613                                  
 29614                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29615                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29616                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29617                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29618                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29619                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29620                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29621                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29622                                  
 29623                                  ;incArgc:
 29624                                  	;push	ax
 29625                                  
 29626                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29627                                  
 29628                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29629                                  
 29630                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29631                                  
 29632                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29633                                  
 29634                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29635                                  
 29636                                  	;pop	ax
 29637                                  	;retn
 29638                                  
 29639                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29640                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29641                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29642                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29643                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29644                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29645                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29646                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29647                                  
 29648                                  isEOL:
 29649                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29650                                  	je	short ieX
 29651                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29652                                  	je	short ieX
 29653                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29654                                  ieX:	
 29655                                  	retn
 29656                                  
 29657                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29658                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29659                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29660                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29661                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29662                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29663                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29664                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29665                                  
 29666                                  isWhite:
 29667                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29668                                  	je	short iwX
 29669                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29670                                  	je	short iwX
 29671                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29672                                  iwX:	
 29673                                  	retn
 29674                                  
 29675                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29676                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29677                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29678                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29679                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29680                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29681                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29682                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29683                                  
 29684                                  unMarkUMB:
 29685                                  	push	ax
 29686                                  	push	bx
 29687                                  	push	di
 29688                                  	push	es
 29689                                  
 29690                                  	push	cs
 29691                                  	pop	es
 29692                                  
 29693                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29694                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29695                                  
 29696                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29697                                  	
 29698                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29699                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29700                                  
 29701                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29702                                  	jne	short umu10
 29703                                  
 29704                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29705                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29706                                  umu10:	
 29707                                  	pop	es
 29708                                  	pop	di
 29709                                  	pop	bx
 29710                                  	pop	ax
 29711                                  	retn
 29712                                  
 29713                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29714                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29715                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29716                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29717                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29718                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29719                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29720                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29721                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29722                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29723                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29724                                  
 29725                                  stowUMB:
 29726                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29727                                  	jb	short su10
 29728                                  	stc
 29729                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29730                                  su10:	
 29731                                  	push	bx
 29732                                  	push	di
 29733                                  	push	si
 29734                                  	push	ds
 29735                                  	push	es
 29736                                  	push	cs
 29737                                  	pop	es
 29738                                  	push	cs
 29739                                  	pop	ds
 29740                                  	
 29741                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29742                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29743                                  	jne	short su20
 29744                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29745                                  su20:	
 29746                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29747                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29748                                  
 29749                                  	mov	bl,al
 29750                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29751                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29752                                  
 29753                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29754                                  
 29755                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29756                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29757                                  
 29758                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29759                                  su30:	
 29760                                  	pop	es
 29761                                  	pop	ds
 29762                                  	pop	si
 29763                                  	pop	di
 29764                                  	pop	bx
 29765                                  	retn
 29766                                  
 29767                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29768                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29769                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29770                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29771                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29772                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29773                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29774                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29775                                  
 29776                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29777                                  
 29778                                  stowSiz:
 29779                                  	push	bx
 29780                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29781                                  	push	es
 29782                                  
 29783                                  	push	cs
 29784                                  	pop	es	
 29785                                  
 29786                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29787                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29788                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29789                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29790                                  	
 29791                                  	pop	es
 29792                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29793                                  	pop	bx
 29794                                  
 29795                                  	retn
 29796                                  
 29797                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29798                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29799                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29800                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29801                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29802                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29803                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29804                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29805                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29806                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29807                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29808                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29809                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29810                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29811                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29812                                  
 29813                                  gnradix:
 29814                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29815                                  
 29816                                  toDigit:
 29817                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29818                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29819                                  
 29820                                  toDigit_hex:
 29821                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29822                                  	jb	short td10
 29823                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29824                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29825                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29826                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29827                                  	retn
 29828                                  td10:	
 29829                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29830                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29831                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29832                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29833                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29834                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29835                                  	retn
 29836                                  toDigit_dec:
 29837                                  td20:	
 29838                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 29839                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 29840                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 29841                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 29842                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 29843                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 29844                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29845                                  	retn
 29846                                  tdE:	
 29847                                  	stc
 29848                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29849                                  	retn
 29850                                  
 29851                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29852                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 29853                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29854                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 29855                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 29856                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 29857                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 29858                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29859                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29860                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29861                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29862                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29863                                  
 29864                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29865                                  
 29866                                  GetXNum:
 29867                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 29868                                  	push	bx
 29869                                  	push	cx
 29870                                  	push	ds
 29871                                  
 29872                                  	cld
 29873                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29874                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29875                                  	xor	cx,cx
 29876                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 29877                                  
 29878                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 29879                                  
 29880                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 29881                                  	;call	toDigit
 29882                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 29883                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 29884                                  
 29885                                  	or	cl,cl
 29886                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 29887                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 29888                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 29889                                  	je	short gxn10
 29890                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 29891                                  	jne	short gxn20
 29892                                  
 29893                                  gxn10:	
 29894                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 29895                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 29896                                  	inc	si
 29897                                  
 29898                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29899                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 29900                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 29901                                  ;        BX    = 0
 29902                                  ;        CH    = 0
 29903                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29904                                  
 29905                                  gxn20:	
 29906                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 29907                                  	inc	si
 29908                                  
 29909                                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 29910                                  	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 29911                                  
 29912                                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 29913                                  	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 29914                                  
 29915                                  	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 29916                                  	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 29917                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 29918                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 29919                                  	jnc	short gxn20
 29920                                  gxnE:	
 29921                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 29922                                  	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 29923                                  gxnQ:	
 29924                                  	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 29925                                  	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 29926                                  gxnX:	
 29927                                  	pop	ds
 29928                                  	pop	cx
 29929                                  	pop	bx
 29930                                  	retn
 29931                                  
 29932                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29933                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 29934                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29935                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 29936                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 29937                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 29938                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29939                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29940                                  
 29941                                  mul32:
 29942                                  	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29943                                  	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29944                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29945                                  	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 29946                                  
 29947                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29948                                  	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29949                                  
 29950                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29951                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29952                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29953                                  	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29954                                  	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29955                                  	retn
 29956                                  m32E:	
 29957                                  	pop	ax
 29958                                  	retn
 29959                                  
 29960                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29961                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 29962                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29963                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 29964                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 29965                                  ; ERROR:   None
 29966                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29967                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29968                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 29969                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 29970                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29971                                  
 29972                                  toPara:
 29973                                  	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 29974                                  
 29975                                  	mov	cl,4		;
 29976                                  	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 29977                                  	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 29978                                  	mov	cl,12
 29979                                  	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 29980                                  	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 29981                                  
 29982                                  	pop	cx
 29983                                  	retn
 29984                                  
 29985                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29986                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 29987                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29988                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 29989                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 29990                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 29991                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29992                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29993                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 29994                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 29995                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 29996                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 29997                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29998                                  
 29999                                  UmbHead:
 30000                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 30001                                  
 30002                                  	;push	si ; ?
 30003                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 30004                                  	;push	es
 30005                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 30006                                  
 30007                                  	; 09/04/2019
 30008                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 30009                                  
 30010                                  	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 30011                                  	int	21h
 30012                                  
 30013                                  	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 30014                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30015                                  	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 30016                                  
 30017                                  	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 30018                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 30019                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30020                                  	retn
 30021                                  uhE:	
 30022                                  	stc
 30023                                  uhX:	
 30024                                  	;pop	bx ; *
 30025                                  	;pop	es
 30026                                  	;pop	ds ; ?
 30027                                  	;pop	si ; ?
