 30028                                  	retn
 30029                                  
 30030                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30031                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 30032                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30033                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 30034                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 30035                                  ; USES:   Flags
 30036                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30037                                  
 30038                                  isSysMCB:
 30039                                  	;push	ax
 30040                                  
 30041                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 30042                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 30043                                  	;je	short ism10
 30044                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 30045                                  	;;je	short ism10
 30046                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 30047                                  	;jne	short ismX
 30048                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 30049                                  	jne	short ismX 
 30050                                  ism10:	
 30051                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 30052                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 30053                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 30054                                  ismX:	
 30055                                  	;pop	ax
 30056                                  	retn
 30057                                  
 30058                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30059                                  
 30060                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30061                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 30062                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30063                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 30064                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 30065                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 30066                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30067                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30068                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 30069                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 30070                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 30071                                  ;      ...
 30072                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 30073                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30074                                  
 30075                                  AddrToUmb:
 30076                                  	push	cx
 30077                                  	push	dx
 30078                                  	push	es
 30079                                  
 30080                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 30081                                  
 30082                                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 30083                                  	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 30084                                  
 30085                                  	mov	es,ax		; ES = first UMB segment
 30086                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 30087                                  
 30088                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 30089                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 30090                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 30091                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 30092                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 30093                                  
 30094                                  atu10:	mov	ax,es
 30095                                          cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 30096                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 30097                                  
 30098                                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 30099                                  	jnz	short atu20
 30100                                  
 30101                                  	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 30102                                  atu20:	
 30103                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 30104                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 30105                                  	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 30106                                  
 30107                                  	;NextMCB es, ax
 30108                                  
 30109                                  	mov     ax,es
 30110                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 30111                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30112                                  	inc     ax
 30113                                  	mov     es,ax
 30114                                  	
 30115                                  	jmp	short atu10
 30116                                  
 30117                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30118                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 30119                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 30120                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30121                                  
 30122                                  atu30:	
 30123                                  	mov	ax,es
 30124                                  	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30125                                  	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 30126                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 30127                                  atuE:	
 30128                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 30129                                  	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 30130                                  atuX:	
 30131                                  	mov	ax, cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 30132                                  	
 30133                                  	pop	es	
 30134                                  	pop	dx
 30135                                  	pop	cx
 30136                                  	retn
 30137                                  
 30138                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30139                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 30140                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 30141                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 30142                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 30143                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30144                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 30145                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 30146                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30147                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30148                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30149                                  
 30150                                  convUMB:
 30151                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30152                                  	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 30153                                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 30154                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30155                                  	jne	short cu10
 30156                                  	inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 30157                                  cu10:	
 30158                                  	retn
 30159                                  
 30160                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30161                                  ;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 30162                                  ;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 30163                                  ; of the usual HIGH_FIRST.  See the code.
 30164                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30165                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30166                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30167                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30168                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30169                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30170                                  
 30171                                  setUMBs:
 30172                                  	push	ax
 30173                                  	push	bx
 30174                                  	call	fm_link
 30175                                  	pop	bx
 30176                                  	pop	ax
 30177                                  	retn
 30178                                  
 30179                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30180                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 30181                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30182                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30183                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 30184                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 30185                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30186                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 30187                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30188                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 30189                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 30190                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 30191                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 30192                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30193                                  
 30194                                  loadLow:
 30195                                  	;push	ds
 30196                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 30197                                  	;pop	ds	
 30198                                  
 30199                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 30200                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30201                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 30202                                  	jne	short ll10
 30203                                  
 30204                                  	stc
 30205                                  ll15:
 30206                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 30207                                  	;stc
 30208                                  	;jmp	short llX
 30209                                  	retn
 30210                                  ll10:	
 30211                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 30212                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 30213                                  
 30214                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30215                                  	retn
 30216                                  
 30217                                  	;mov	al,1
 30218                                  	;clc
 30219                                  ;llX:
 30220                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 30221                                  	;retn
 30222                                  
 30223                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30224                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 30225                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30226                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30227                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30228                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30229                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 30230                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30231                                  
 30232                                  HideUMBs:
 30233                                  	push	ax
 30234                                  	push	cx
 30235                                  	push	ds
 30236                                  	push	es
 30237                                  
 30238                                  	call	UmbTest		; See if we REALLY linked in anything...
 30239                                  	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.
 30240                                  
 30241                                  	call	FixMem		; Concatenate adjacent free MCBs in upper mem
 30242                                  	call	setUMBs		; Link UMBs and set memory-allocation strategy
 30243                                  
 30244                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 30245                                  	mov	byte [cs:fInHigh],1
 30246                                  
 30247                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 30248                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30249                                  
 30250                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED	; If they didn't,
 30251                                  	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 30252                                  
 30253                                  	xor	cx,cx
 30254                                  
 30255                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 30256                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)
 30257                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 30258                                  
 30259                                  hus10:	inc	cx		; For each UMB:
 30260                                  	cmp	cx,MAXUMB ; 16
 30261                                  	jae	short hus20
 30262                                  
 30263                                  	mov	al,cl		; (stopping as soon as we're outside of the
 30264                                  	push	es
 30265                                  	call	findUMB		; valid range of UMBs)
 30266                                  	pop	es		; push/pop: trash what findumb finds.  :-)
 30267                                  	jc	short hus20
 30268                                  
 30269                                  	call	_hideUMB_	; hide what we need to hide.
 30270                                  
 30271                                  	jmp	short hus10
 30272                                  hus20:	
 30273                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; Now check if they offered /L:0
 30274                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30275                                  
 30276                                  	or	al,al		; --Is the load UMB 0? (-1==unspecified)
 30277                                  	jnz	short husX	; If not, we're done.
 30278                                  
 30279                                  	call	hl_unlink	; If so, however, fix UMBs and strategy.
 30280                                  husX:	
 30281                                  	pop	es
 30282                                  	pop	ds
 30283                                  	pop	cx
 30284                                  	pop	ax
 30285                                  	retn
 30286                                  
 30287                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30288                                  ;*** GetLoadUMB - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 30289                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30291                                  ; EXIT:   AL == load UMB
 30292                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30293                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30294                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30295                                  
 30296                                  ;GetLoadUMB:
 30297                                  ;	;getdata al, UmbLoad
 30298                                  ;	push	ds
 30299                                  ;	push	cs
 30300                                  ;	pop	ds
 30301                                  ;	mov	al,[UmLoad]

 30303                                  ;	retn
 30304                                  
 30305                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30306                                  ;*** GetLoadSize - Returns the load UMB minimum size (0 if not specified)
 30307                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30308                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30309                                  ; EXIT:   AX == load UMB minimum size
 30310                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30311                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30312                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30313                                  
 30314                                  GetLoadSize:
 30315                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30316                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30317                                  	jmp	short GetSize
 30318                                  
 30319                                  	;push	bx
 30320                                  	;;push	si
 30321                                  	;push	ds
 30322                                  	;push	cs
 30323                                  	;pop	ds
 30324                                  
 30325                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 30326                                  
 30327                                  	;xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 30328                                  	;mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 30329                                  	;shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 30330                                  	;;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 30331                                  	;;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 30332                                  
 30333                                  	;;lodsw				;    ax==size
 30334                                  
 30335                                  	;add	bx,ax
 30336                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 30337                                  
 30338                                  	;pop	ds
 30339                                  	;;pop	si
 30340                                  	;pop	bx
 30341                                  	;retn
 30342                                  
 30343                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30344                                  ;*** GetSize - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 30345                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30346                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == a UMB number
 30347                                  ; EXIT:   AX == UMB minimum size, as specified by the user
 30348                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30349                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30350                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30351                                  
 30352                                  GetSize:
 30353                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30354                                  
 30355                                  	push	bx
 30356                                  	;push	si
 30357                                  	;push	ds
 30358                                  	;push	cs
 30359                                  	;pop	ds
 30360                                  
 30361                                  	xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 30362                                  	mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 30363                                  	shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 30364                                  	;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 30365                                  	;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 30366                                  
 30367                                  	;lodsw				;    ax==size
 30368                                  
 30369                                  	add	bx,ax
 30370                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 30371                                  	mov	ax,[cs:bx]
 30372                                  
 30373                                  	;pop	ds
 30374                                  	;pop	si
 30375                                  	pop	bx
 30376                                  	retn
 30377                                  
 30378                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30379                                  ;*** StoLoadUMB - Overrides the load UMB number with what's in AL
 30380                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30382                                  ; EXIT:    None

 30385                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30387                                  ;          time you would ever need this, so that's okay.
 30388                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30389                                  
 30390                                  ;StoLoadUMB:
 30391                                  ;	;putdata UmbLoad, al
 30392                                  ;	push	es
 30393                                  ;	push	cs

 30395                                  ;	mov	[es:UmbLoad],al

 30398                                  
 30399                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30400                                  ;*** StoLoadSize - Overrides the load UMB minimum size with what's in AX
 30401                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30402                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == new load size
 30403                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30404                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30405                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30406                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30407                                  
 30408                                  StoLoadSize:
 30409                                  	push	dx
 30410                                  
 30411                                  	;getdata dl, UmbLoad		; Put UMB# in DL and size in AX
 30412                                  	;
 30413                                  	;push	ds
 30414                                  	;push	cs
 30415                                  	;pop	ds
 30416                                  	;mov	dl,[UmbLoad]
 30417                                  	;pop	ds	
 30418                                  
 30419                                  	mov	dl,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30420                                  
 30421                                  	cmp	dl,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30422                                  	je	short sls10
 30423                                  
 30424                                  	call	stowSiz			; We've got a function to do just this
 30425                                  sls10:	
 30426                                  	pop	dx
 30427                                  	retn
 30428                                  
 30429                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30430                                  ;*** hideUMB - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 30431                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30432                                  ; ENTRY:    AL must indicate a valid UMB; 0==conv && is invalid.
 30433                                  ; EXIT:     None; free elements in UMB marked as hidden
 30434                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30435                                  ; USES:     Flags
 30436                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30437                                  
 30438                                  hideUMB:
 30439                                  	push	ax
 30440                                  	push	es
 30441                                  
 30442                                  	call	findUMB		; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 30443                                  	jc	short huX
 30444                                  
 30445                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30446                                  ; HU10--ES - MCB inside UMB; if it's a system MCB,
 30447                                  ;            we're not in the same UMB, so exit.
 30448                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30449                                  
 30450                                  hu10:	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 30451                                  	jz	short huX	; If it is, we've finished the UMB.
 30452                                  	;call	isFreeMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 30453                                  	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 30454                                  	jnz	short hu20
 30455                                  
 30456                                  	call	hideMCB
 30457                                  hu20:	
 30458                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 30459                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ;'Z'
 30460                                  	jz	short huX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 30461                                  
 30462                                  	;NextMCB es, ax		; Go on forward.
 30463                                  	mov     ax,es
 30464                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 30465                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30466                                  	inc     ax
 30467                                  	mov     es,ax
 30468                                  
 30469                                  	jmp	short hu10
 30470                                  huX:	
 30471                                  	pop	es
 30472                                  	pop	ax
 30473                                  	retn
 30474                                  
 30475                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30476                                  ;*** isTiny - returns with ZF set if user didn't specify /S

 30500
