 31706 000028F2 5E                      	pop	si
 31707 000028F3 1F                      	pop	ds
 31708 000028F4 5F                      	pop	di
 31709 000028F5 07                      	pop	es
 31710 000028F6 C3                      	retn

 31715                                  ;
 31716                                  ;	Input : ES:SI - points to device file to be sized
 31717                                  ;

 31719                                  ;
 31720                                  ;	Calculates the size of the device file in paras and stores it
 31721                                  ;	in DevSize
 31722                                  ;
 31723                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31724                                  
 31725                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 31726                                  SizeDevice:
 31727                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31728                                  	; 11/12/2022 ; *

 31741 0000290C CD21                    	int	21h

 31743 00002910 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; para convert
 31744 00002913 83D200                  	adc	dx,0
 31745 00002916 F7C2F0FF                	test	dx,0FFF0h		; size > 0ffff paras ?
 31746 0000291A 7409                    	jz	short szdev1		; no

 31748                                  					; assuming that we fail later
 31749 00002923 EB1A                    	jmp	short sd_close
 31750                                  szdev1:
 31751 00002925 B104                    	mov	cl,4			; convert it to paras
 31752 00002927 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl
 31753 00002929 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31754 0000292B D3E2                    	shl	dx,cl
 31755 0000292D 09D0                    	or	ax,dx
 31756                                  	;
 31757                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31758 0000292F 2E3B06[FC1E]            	cmp     ax,[cs:DevSizeOption]

 31769                                  	; 12/12/2022

 31771                                  	;clc

 32093                                  ;
 32094                                  ; procedure : GetHexNum
 32095                                  ;
 32096                                  ;	Converts an ascii string terminated by a delimiter into binary.
 32097                                  ;	Assumes that the ES:SI points to a Hexadecimal string
 32098                                  ;
 32099                                  ;	Returns in AX the number number of paras equivalent to the
 32100                                  ;	hex number of bytes specified by the hexadecimal string.
 32101                                  ;
 32102                                  ;	Returns carry in case it encountered a non-hex character or
 32103                                  ;	if it encountered crlf
 32104                                  ;
 32105                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32106                                  
 32107                                  ; 13/05/2019
 32108                                  
 32109                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32110                                  	; (SYSINIT:2DA5h)
 32111                                  GetHexNum:
 32112 00002A2B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 32113 00002A2D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 32114                                  ghn_next:
 32115 00002A2F 268A1C                  	mov	bl,[es:si]
 32116 00002A32 80FB0D                  	cmp	bl,cr  ; 0Dh
 32117 00002A35 7436                    	je	short ghn_err
 32118 00002A37 80FB0A                  	cmp	bl,lf  ; 0Ah
 32119 00002A3A 7431                    	je	short ghn_err
 32120 00002A3C 50                      	push	ax
 32121 00002A3D 88D8                    	mov	al,bl
 32122 00002A3F E83706                  	call	delim
 32123 00002A42 58                      	pop	ax
 32124                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32125 00002A43 B90400                  	mov	cx, 4
 32126 00002A46 7410                    	jz	short ghn_into_paras
 32127 00002A48 E82400                  	call	GetNibble
 32128                                  	;jc	short ghn_err
 32129                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32130 00002A4B 7221                    	jc	short ghn_ret ; cf=1
 32131                                  	; 04/01/2023

 32281                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32282                                  ;
 32283                                  ; Procedure Name	: umb_allocate
 32284                                  ;
 32285                                  ; Inputs		: DS = data
 32286                                  ;
 32287                                  ; Outputs		: if UMB available
 32288                                  ;				Allocates the largest available UMB and 
 32289                                  ;			  	BX = segment of allocated block
 32290                                  ;				DX = size of allocated block
 32291                                  ;				NC
 32292                                  ;			  else 
 32293                                  ;				CY
 32294                                  ;
 32295                                  ; Uses			: BX, DX
 32296                                  ;
 32297                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32298                                  
 32299                                  umb_allocate:
 32300                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32301                                  	; ds = cs
 32302 00002ACC 50                      	push	ax
 32303 00002ACD B410                    	mov	ah,XMM_REQUEST_UMB ; 16
 32304 00002ACF BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh		; try to allocate largest
 32305                                  					;   possible
 32306                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32307 00002AD2 FF1E[F31E]              	call	far [DevXMSAddr]
 32308                                  	;call	far [cs:DevXMSAddr]
 32309                                  					; dx now contains the size of
 32310                                  					; the largest UMB
 32311 00002AD6 09D2                    	or	dx,dx
 32312 00002AD8 740D                    	jz	short ua_err
 32313                                  	
 32314 00002ADA B410                    	mov	ah,XMM_REQUEST_UMB ; 16
 32315                                  
 32316                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32317 00002ADC FF1E[F31E]              	call	far [DevXMSAddr]
 32318                                  	;call	far [cs:DevXMSAddr]
 32319                                  
 32320 00002AE0 83F801                  	cmp	ax,1			; Q: was the reqst successful
 32321 00002AE3 7502                    	jne	short ua_err		; N: error
 32322                                  	;clc
 32323                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32324                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32325                                  	; cf=0
 32326                                  	;clc 
 32327                                  ua_done:
 32328 00002AE5 58                      	pop	ax
 32329 00002AE6 C3                      	retn
 32330                                  ua_err:
 32331 00002AE7 F9                      	stc
 32332 00002AE8 EBFB                    	jmp	short ua_done
 32333                                  
 32334                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32335                                  ;
 32336                                  ; Procedure Name	: umb_insert
 32337                                  ;
 32338                                  ; Inputs		: DOSDATA:UMB_HEAD = start of umb chain
 32339                                  ;			: BX = seg address of UMB to be linked in
 32340                                  ;			: DX = size of UMB to be linked in paras
 32341                                  ;			; DS = data
 32342                                  ;
 32343                                  ; Outputs		: links the UMB into the arena chain
 32344                                  ;
 32345                                  ; Uses			: AX, CX, ES, DX, BX
 32346                                  ;
 32347                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32348                                  
 32349                                  umb_insert:
 32350 00002AEA 1E                      	push	ds
 32351                                  
 32352                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32353                                  	; ds = cs
 32354                                  
 32355                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:DevDOSData]
 32356 00002AEB 8E1E[0A1F]              	mov	ds,[DevDOSData] ; 31/12/2022 
 32357                                  	;mov	ds,[8Ch]
 32358 00002AEF 8E1E8C00                	mov	ds,[UMB_ARENA]		; es = UMB_HEAD
 32359 00002AF3 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 32360 00002AF5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 32361                                  ui_next:
 32362 00002AF7 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx			; Q: is current block above
 32363                                  					;    new block
 32364 00002AF9 770F                    	ja	short ui_insert		; Y: insert it
 32365                                  					; Q: is current block the
 32366                                  					;    last
 32367 00002AFB 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32368 00002B01 745C                    	je	short ui_append		; Y: append new block to chain
 32369                                  					; N: get next block
 32370 00002B03 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; M005
 32371                                  	;call	get_next		; ax = es = next block
 32372 00002B05 E8E200                  	call	_get_next_ ; 13/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32373 00002B08 EBED                    	jmp	short ui_next
 32374                                  
 32375                                  ui_insert:
 32376 00002B0A 8CD9                    	mov	cx,ds			; ds = previous arena
 32377 00002B0C 41                      	inc	cx			; top of previous block
 32378                                  
 32379 00002B0D 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx
 32380 00002B0F F7D9                    	neg	cx			; cx = size of used block
 32381                                  	;mov	byte [0],'M'
 32382 00002B11 C60600004D              	mov	byte [ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 32383                                  	;mov	word [1],8
 32384 00002B16 C70601000800            	mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 32385                                  	;mov	[3],cx
 32386 00002B1C 890E0300                	mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx	
 32387                                  	;mov	word [8],4353h ; 'SC'
 32388 00002B20 C70608005343            	mov	word [ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; 4353h
 32389                                  
 32390                                  ; prepare the arena at start of new block
 32391                                  
 32392 00002B26 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 32393 00002B28 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 32394 00002B2E 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],arena_owner_system ; 0
 32395                                  					; mark as free
 32396 00002B35 83EA02                  	sub	dx,2			; make room for arena at
 32397                                  					; start & end of new block
 32398 00002B38 2689160300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],dx
 32399                                  
 32400                                  ; prepare arena at end of new block
 32401                                  	
 32402 00002B3D 01D3                    	add	bx,dx
 32403 00002B3F 43                      	inc	bx
 32404 00002B40 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; es=arena at top of new block
 32405 00002B42 43                      	inc	bx			; bx=top of new block
 32406                                  
 32407                                  					; ax contains arena just above
 32408                                  					; this block
 32409 00002B43 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx			; ax = size of used block
 32410                                  	
 32411 00002B45 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal
 32412 00002B4B 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 32413 00002B52 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax	
 32414 00002B56 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; 4353h
 32415                                  
 32416 00002B5D EB47                    	jmp	short ui_done
 32417                                  
 32418                                  ui_append:
 32419                                  					; es = arena of last block	
 32420 00002B5F 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; ax=top of last block-1 para
 32421 00002B64 26832E030001            	sub	word [es:ARENA.SIZE],1	; reflect the space we are
 32422                                  					; going to rsrv on top of this 
 32423                                  					; block for the next arena.
 32424                                  	; 13/05/2019
 32425 00002B6A 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal
 32426                                  
 32427 00002B70 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			; cx=top of prev block-1
 32428 00002B72 40                      	inc	ax
 32429 00002B73 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx			; ax=top of prev block - 
 32430                                  					;    seg. address of new block
 32431 00002B75 F7D8                    	neg	ax
 32432                                  
 32433 00002B77 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; ds = arena of unused block
 32434                                  
 32435 00002B79 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal
 32436 00002B7F 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 32437 00002B86 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax	
 32438 00002B8A 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 32439                                  
 32440                                  ; prepare the arena at start of new block
 32441 00002B91 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 32442 00002B93 26C60600005A            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 32443 00002B99 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],arena_owner_system
 32444                                  					; mark as free
 32445 00002BA0 4A                      	dec	dx			; make room for arena
 32446 00002BA1 2689160300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],dx	
 32447                                  ui_done:
 32448                                  uc_done: ; 31/12/2022 ; *!
 32449 00002BA6 1F                      	pop	ds
 32450                                  	; ds = cs ; 31/12/2022
 32451                                  ;uc_done:	; 18/12/2022
 32452 00002BA7 C3                      	retn
 32453                                  
 32454                                  ; 13/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32455                                  
 32456                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32457                                  ;
 32458                                  ;**	umb_coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 32459                                  ;
 32460                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 32461                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 32462                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 32463                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 32464                                  ;
 32465                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 32466                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 32467                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 32468                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 32469                                  ;	USES	cx, di, ds, es
 32470                                  ;
 32471                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32472                                  
 32473                                  umb_coalesce:
 32474                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32475                                  	; ds = cs
 32476 00002BA8 1E                      	push	ds ; *!
 32477                                  
 32478 00002BA9 31FF                    	xor	di, di
 32479                                  
 32480                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]
 32481                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32482 00002BAB 8E06[0A1F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData]
 32483 00002BAF 268E068C00              	mov	es,[es:UMB_ARENA]	; es = UMB_HEAD
 32484                                  uc_nextfree:
 32485 00002BB4 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 32486 00002BB6 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 32487                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 32488 00002BB8 26393E0100              	cmp	[es:ARENA.OWNER],di	; Q: is current arena free
 32489 00002BBD 7407                    	je	short uc_again		; Y: try to coalesce with next block
 32490                                  					; N: get next arena
 32491 00002BBF E82100                  	call	get_next		; es, ax = next arena
 32492 00002BC2 72E2                    	jc	short uc_done	; *!
 32493 00002BC4 EBEE                    	jmp	short uc_nextfree
 32494                                  uc_again:
 32495 00002BC6 E81A00                  	call	get_next		; ES, AX <- next block
 32496 00002BC9 72DB                    	jc	short uc_done	; *!
 32497                                  uc_check:
 32498 00002BCB 26393E0100              	cmp     [es:ARENA.OWNER],di	; Q: is arena free
 32499 00002BD0 75E2                    	jne	short uc_nextfree	; N: get next free arena
 32500                                  					; Y: coalesce
 32501 00002BD2 268B0E0300              	mov     cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]      ; cx <- next block size
 32502 00002BD7 41                      	inc     cx                      ; cx <- cx + 1 (for header size)
 32503                                  	;add	[3],cx
 32504 00002BD8 010E0300                	add     [ARENA.SIZE],cx		; current size <- current size + cx
 32505 00002BDC 268A0D                  	mov     cl,[es:di]              ; move up signature
 32506 00002BDF 880D                    	mov     [di],cl
 32507 00002BE1 EBE3                    	jmp     short uc_again		; try again
 32508                                  
 32509                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32510                                  ;uc_done:
 32511                                  	;retn
 32512                                  
 32513                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32514                                  ;
 32515                                  ;**	get_next - Find Next item in Arena
 32516                                  ;
 32517                                  ;	ENTRY	dS - pointer to block head
 32518                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 32519                                  ;		'C' set if arena damaged
 32520                                  ;
 32521                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32522                                  
 32523                                  	; 01/11/2022
 32524                                  get_next:
 32525 00002BE3 803E00005A              	cmp	byte [0],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32526 00002BE8 740A                    	je	short gn_err
 32527                                  _get_next_:
 32528 00002BEA 8CD8                    	mov     ax,ds                   ; ax=current block
 32529 00002BEC 03060300                	add     ax,[ARENA.SIZE]		; ax=ax + current block length
 32530 00002BF0 40                      	inc     ax                      ; remember that header!
 32531 00002BF1 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 32532                                  	;clc
 32533                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32534                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32535                                  	; cf=0
 32536                                  	;clc
 32537 00002BF3 C3                      	retn
 32538                                  gn_err:
 32539 00002BF4 F9                      	stc
 32540                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 32541                                  lfu_err:	 ; cf=1
 32542 00002BF5 C3                      	retn
 32543                                  
 32544                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32545                                  ;
 32546                                  ; procedure : LinkFirstUMB
 32547                                  ;
 32548                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32549                                  
 32550                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32551                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F81h)
 32552                                  LinkFirstUMB:
 32553                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32554                                  	; ds = cs
 32555 00002BF6 E8D3FE                  	call	umb_allocate
 32556 00002BF9 72FA                    	jc	short lfu_err  ; ds = cs ; 31/12/2022
 32557                                  
 32558                                  ; bx = segment of allocated UMB
 32559                                  ; dx = size of UMB
 32560                                  
 32561                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32562                                  	; ds = cs
 32563                                  
 32564 00002BFB CD12                    	int	12h			; ax = size of memory
 32565 00002BFD B106                    	mov	cl,6
 32566 00002BFF D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; ax = size in paragraphs
 32567                                  
 32568 00002C01 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			; cx = size in paras
 32569 00002C03 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx			; ax = - size of unused block
 32570                                  
 32571 00002C05 F7D8                    	neg	ax
 32572                                  
 32573 00002C07 83E901                  	sub	cx,1			; cx = first umb_arena
 32574 00002C0A 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; es = first umb_arena
 32575                                  	
 32576 00002C0C 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 32577 00002C12 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 32578                                  					
 32579 00002C19 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax	
 32580 00002C1D 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; 4353h
 32581                                  
 32582                                  ; put in the arena for the first UMB
 32583                                  
 32584 00002C24 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; es has first free umb seg
 32585 00002C26 26C60600005A            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32586 00002C2C 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],arena_owner_system ; 0	
 32587                                  					; mark as free 
 32588 00002C33 4A                      	dec	dx			; make room for arena
 32589 00002C34 2689160300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],dx	
 32590                                  
 32591                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]
 32592                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32593 00002C39 8E06[0A1F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData] ; ds = cs
 32594 00002C3D BF8C00                  	mov	di,UMB_ARENA ; 8Ch
 32595 00002C40 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx		; initialize umb_head in DOS
 32596                                  					;  data segment with the arena
 32597                                  					;  just below Top of Mem
 32598                                  
 32599                                  ; we must now scan the arena chain and update the size of the last arena
 32600                                  
 32601 00002C43 BF2400                  	mov	di,DOS_ARENA ; 24h
 32602 00002C46 268E05                  	mov	es,[es:di]		; es = start arena
 32603 00002C49 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 32604                                  ;scan_next
 32605                                  ; 09/12/2022
 32606                                  scannext:
 32607 00002C4B 26803D5A                	cmp	byte [es:di],arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 32608 00002C4F 740C                    	je	short got_last
 32609                                  	
 32610 00002C51 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 32611 00002C53 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32612 00002C58 40                      	inc	ax
 32613 00002C59 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax

 32658 00002C77 2B1E[ED1E]              	sub	bx,[DevUMBAddr]
 32659 00002C7B 8E06[ED1E]              	mov	es,[DevUMBAddr]
 32660

 32662 00002C82 CD21                    	int	21h

 32664                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 32665                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs

 32701 00002CB1 7404                    	je	short ulu_found

 32712                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32713                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 32714                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32715                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32716                                  
 32717                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 32718                                  ;
 32719                                  ; Summary:
 32720                                  ;
 32721                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 32722                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 32723                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 32724                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 32725                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 32726                                  ;
 32727                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 32728                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 32729                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 32730                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 32731                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 32732                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 32733                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 32734                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 32735                                  ;
 32736                                  ; Example:
 32737                                  ;
 32738                                  ;   [menu]
 32739                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 32740                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 32741                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 32742                                  ;
 32743                                  ;   [network]
 32744                                  ;   include misc
 32745                                  ;   device=foo
 32746                                  ;
 32747                                  ;   [misc]
 32748                                  ;   device=bar
 32749                                  ;   include alternate
 32750                                  ;
 32751                                  ;   [alternate]
 32752                                  ;   device=tar
 32753                                  ;
 32754                                  ;
 32755                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 32756                                  ;
 32757                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 32758                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 32759                                  ;
 32760                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 32761                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 32762                                  ;   following order:
 32763                                  ;
 32764                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 32765                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 32766                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 32767                                  ;
 32768                                  
 32769                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 32770                                  
 32771                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 32772                                  
 32773                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 32774                                  
 32775                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 32776                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 32777                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 32778                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 32779                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 32780                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 32781                                  
 32782                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32783                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32784                                  
 32785                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 32786                                  
 32787                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32788                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 32789                                  
 32790 00002CBF 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0
 32791

 32900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32901                                  ;
 32902                                  ; procedure : parseline
 32903                                  ;
 32904                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 32905                                  ;
 32906                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32907                                  
 32908                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32909                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 32910                                  
 32911                                  parseline:
 32912                                  	push	ds
 32913                                  
 32914                                  	push	cs
 32915                                  	pop	ds
 32916                                  
 32917                                  nextswtch:
 32918                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 32919                                  	je	short done_line
 32920                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 32921                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 32922                                  
 32923                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 32924                                  
 32925                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 32926                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 32927                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 32928                                  	je	short getparm
 32929                                  	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 32930                                  	jmp	short exitpl
 32931                                  
 32932                                  getparm:
 32933                                  	call	check_switch
 32934                                  	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 32935                                  	jc	short swterr
 32936                                  getnext:
 32937                                  	call	getchr
 32938                                  	jc	short done_line
 32939                                  	jmp	short nextswtch
 32940                                  swterr:
 32941                                  	jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 32942                                  
 32943                                  done_line:
 32944                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32945                                  	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 32946                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 32947                                  	jnz	short okay
 32948                                  	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 32949                                  	jmp	short exitpl
 32950                                  
 32951                                  okay:
 32952                                  	mov	ax,[switches]
 32953                                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 32954                                  	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 32955                                  	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 32956                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 32957                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32958                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32959                                  	; cf=0
 32960                                  	;clc
 32961                                  	call	setdeviceparameters
 32962                                  exitpl:
 32963                                  	pop	ds
 32964                                  	retn
 32965                                  put_back:
 32966                                  	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 32967                                  	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 32968                                  	jmp	short done_line
 32969                                  
 32970                                  %endif
 32971                                  
 32972                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32973                                  ;
 32974                                  ; procedure : check_switch
 32975                                  ;
 32976                                  ; processes a switch in the input. it ensures that the switch is valid, and
 32977                                  ; gets the number, if any required, following the switch. the switch and the
 32978                                  ; number *must* be separated by a colon. carry is set if there is any kind of
 32979                                  ; error.
 32980                                  ;
 32981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32982                                  
 32983                                  check_switch:

 32985                                  	;jc	short err_check
 32986 00002D18 724E                    	jc	short err_chk
 32987 00002D1A 24DF                            and     al,0DFh                 ; convert it to upper case
 32988 00002D1C 3C41                    	cmp	al,'A'
 32989                                  	;jb	short err_check
 32990 00002D1E 7248                    	jb	short err_chk ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32991 00002D20 3C5A                    	cmp	al,'Z'
 32992 00002D22 7743                    	ja	short err_check
 32993                                  
 32994 00002D24 06                      	push	es
 32995                                  
 32996 00002D25 0E                      	push	cs
 32997 00002D26 07                      	pop	es
 32998                                  
 32999 00002D27 8A0E[9637]              	mov	cl,[switchlist]		; get number of valid switches
 33000 00002D2B B500                    	mov	ch,0
 33001 00002D2D BF[9737]                	mov	di,1+switchlist		; point to string of valid switches
 33002 00002D30 F2AE                    	repne	scasb
 33003                                  
 33004 00002D32 07                      	pop	es
 33005 00002D33 7532                    	jnz	short err_check
 33006                                  
 33007 00002D35 B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 33008 00002D38 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; set bit to indicate switch
 33009 00002D3A 8B1E[0337]              	mov	bx,[switches]		; get switches so far
 33010 00002D3E 09C3                    	or	bx,ax			; save this with other switches
 33011 00002D40 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 33012                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33013 00002D42 A8F8                    	test	al,switchnum ; 0F8h
 33014                                  	;test	ax,switchnum ; 0F8h	; test against switches that require number to follow
 33015 00002D44 741E                    	jz	short done_swtch
 33016                                  
 33017 00002D46 E8E6F9                  	call	getchr
 33018 00002D49 721A                    	jc	short err_swtch
 33019                                  
 33020 00002D4B 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'
 33021 00002D4D 7516                    	jne	short err_swtch
 33022                                  
 33023 00002D4F E8DDF9                  	call	getchr
 33024 00002D52 53                      	push	bx			; preserve switches
 33025                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33026                                  	;mov	byte [cs:sepchr],' '	; allow space separators
 33027                                  	; 12/12/2022

 33033 00002D5B C606[2A03]00            	mov	byte [sepchr],0

 33035                                  
 33036                                  ; because getnum does not consider carriage-return or line-feed as ok, we do
 33037                                  ; not check for carry set here. if there is an error, it will be detected
 33038                                  ; further on (hopefully).
 33039                                  
 33040 00002D61 E80500                  	call	process_num
 33041                                  
 33042                                  done_swtch:
 33043                                  	;clc
 33044                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33045                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33046                                  	; cf=0
 33047                                  	;clc
 33048 00002D64 C3                      	retn
 33049                                  
 33050                                  err_swtch:

 33052                                  err_check:

 33054                                  err_chk:

 33059                                  ; procedure : process_num
 33060                                  ;
 33061                                  ; this routine takes the switch just input, and the number following (if any),
 33062                                  ; and sets the value in the appropriate variable. if the number input is zero
 33063                                  ; then it does nothing - it assumes the default value that is present in the
 33064                                  ; variable at the beginning. zero is ok for form factor and drive, however.
 33065                                  ;

 33094                                  	;jmp	short done_ret

 33098                                  try_t:

 33113                                  try_s:

 33116                                  	;test	cx,flagseclim ; 20h

 33120                                  	;jmp	short done_ret

 33124                                  
 33125                                  ; must be for number of heads

 33144                                  ; procedure : parseline
 33145                                  ;
 33146                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.

 33157

 33159                                  	;pop	ds ; *

 33161                                  nextswtch:

 33165 00002DA1 7421                    	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 33166

 33168

 33182 00002DB4 72F6                    	jc	short swterr
 33183                                  getnext:

 33185                                  	;jc	short done_line
 33186                                  	;jmp	short nextswtch
 33187                                  	; 04/01/2023

 33190                                  	;jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error

 33201

 33205                                  	;;pop	ds ; *

 33232                                  ;
 33233                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 33234                                  ;
 33235                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 33236                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 33237                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 33238                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 33239                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 33240                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 33241                                  ;
 33242                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 33243                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 33244                                  ;
 33245                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 33246                                  ;
 33247                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33248                                  
 33249                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33250                                  
 33251                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 33252                                  setdeviceparameters:
 33253                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33254                                  	; ds = cs
 33255                                  	
 33256 00002DDD 06                      	push	es
 33257                                  
 33258 00002DDE 0E                      	push	cs
 33259 00002DDF 07                      	pop	es
 33260

 33313                                  
 33314 00002E21 B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 33315

 33317

 33319                                  	; 02/11/2022
 33320 00002E23 8A3E[EB35]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 33321

 33323                                  	; ax = 2
 33324 00002E27 3906[F035]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 33325                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 33326 00002E2B 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 33327                                  
 33328 00002E2D 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 33329                                  
 33330                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 33331                                  
 33332 00002E2F 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 33333                                  
 33334                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 33335                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 33336                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 33337                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 33338                                  
 33339                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 33340                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 33341                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 33342                                  
 33343 00002E31 833E[EE35]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 33344 00002E36 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 33345 00002E38 833E[DE35]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 33346 00002E3D 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 33347                                  
 33348                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 33349                                  
 33350 00002E3F EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33351                                  
 33352                                  ;	check for 320K
 33353                                  
 33354                                  not_144m:
 33355 00002E41 833E[DE35]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 33356 00002E46 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33357 00002E48 833E[EE35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33358 00002E4D 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33359                                  
 33360 00002E4F B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 33361 00002E51 EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 33362                                  
 33363                                  only_one_head:
 33364                                  
 33365                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 33366                                  
 33367 00002E53 803E[DB35]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 33368 00002E58 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33369                                  
 33370                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 33371                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 33372                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 33373                                  
 33374 00002E5A B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 33375 00002E5C 833E[EE35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33376                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33377 00002E61 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 33378                                  
 33379 00002E63 B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 33380                                  
 33381                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 33382                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 33383                                  
 33384                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 33385                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33386                                  	; ax = 2
 33387 00002E65 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 33388 00002E66 A2[E335]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 33389                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 33390                                  
 33391                                  got_correct_mediad:
 33392 00002E69 881E[EB35]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 33393                                  
 33394                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 33395                                  
 33396 00002E6D A1[DE35]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 33397 00002E70 F726[F035]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS]
 33398 00002E74 F726[EE35]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]
 33399 00002E78 A3[E935]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS],ax
 33400 00002E7B F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 33401                                  
 33402 00002E7C C3                      	retn
 33403

 33875                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33876                                  ;
 33877                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 33878                                  ;
 33879                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 33880                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 33881                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 33882                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 33883                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 33884                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 33885                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 33886                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 33887                                  ;
 33888                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33889                                  
 33890                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33891                                  
 33892                                  skip_comment:
 33893 00003043 E3EE                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 33894                                  
 33895                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33896                                  	; ds = cs	
 33897                                  
 33898 00003045 803E[CC03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 33899                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 33900 0000304A 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 33901                                  
 33902 0000304C 803E[CD03]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 33903                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 33904 00003051 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 33905                                  
 33906 00003053 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33907                                  	
 33908 00003056 3806[CE03]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 33909                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 33910 0000305A 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 33911                                  
 33912 0000305C 803E[CD03]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 33913                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 33914 00003061 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33915                                  
 33916 00003063 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 33917                                  	
 33918 00003067 3806[CF03]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 33919                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 33920 0000306B 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 33921                                  skip_cmmt:
 33922 0000306D E3C4                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 33923 0000306F 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33924 00003072 46                      	inc	si
 33925 00003073 49                      	dec	cx
 33926 00003074 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 33927 00003076 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33928                                  no_commt:
 33929 00003078 C3                      	retn

 33936                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33937                                  ;
 33938                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 33939                                  ;
 33940                                  ;   INPUT
 33941                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33942                                  ;
 33943                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33944                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 33945                                  ;
 33946                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33947                                  ;       All
 33948                                  ;
 33949                                  ;   HISTORY
 33950                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33951                                  ;
 33952                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33953                                  
 33954                                  kbd_read:
 33955                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 33956                                          jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 33957                                  
 33958                                          push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 33959                                          sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 33960                                          mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 33961                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 33962                                  kbd_loop:
 33963                                          mov     ah,1            ;
 33964                                          int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 33965                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 33966                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33967                                          int     16h             ;
 33968                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33969                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 33970                                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 33971                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 33972                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33973                                  	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 33974                                  
 33975                                  	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?
 33976                                          jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 33977                                  kbd_loopdone:
 33978                                          pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 33979                                  kbd_nodelay:
 33980                                          sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 33981                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33982                                          int     16h             ;
 33983                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33984                                          jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 33985                                          inc     bx              ; yes
 33986                                          inc     bx
 33987                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 33988                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 33989                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 33990                                          mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 33991                                          int     16h             ;
 33992                                          jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 33993                                          or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 33994                                          jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 33995                                  
 33996                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 33997                                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 33998                                          je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 33999                                  	
 34000                                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 34001                                          jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 34002                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 34003                                          mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 34004                                          call    print
 34005                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 34006                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4           ;
 34007                                          jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 34008                                  kbd_notf5:
 34009                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 34010                                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 34011                                          je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 34012                                  
 34013                                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 34014                                          jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 34015                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 34016                                          mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 34017                                          call    print           ;
 34018                                          mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 34019                                          mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 34020                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 34021                                          mov     ah,0            ;
 34022                                          int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 34023                                          mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 34024                                          or      bx,bx           ;
 34025                                          jz	short kbd_clean	;
 34026                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 34027                                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 34028                                          jb	short kbd_exit	;
 34029                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 34030                                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 34031                                          stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 34032                                          retn			;
 34033                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 34034                                          clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 34035                                          retn			;
 34036                                  
 34037                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34038                                  ;
 34039                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 34040                                  ;
 34041                                  ;   INPUT
 34042                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 34043                                  ;
 34044                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34045                                  ;       None
 34046                                  ;
 34047                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34048                                  ;       None
 34049                                  ;
 34050                                  ;   HISTORY
 34051                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 34052                                  ;
 34053                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34054                                  
 34055                                  set_numlock:
 34056                                          push    ax
 34057                                          push    ds
 34058                                          sub     ax,ax
 34059                                          mov     ds,ax
 34060                                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 34061                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 34062                                          jne	short not_off	; no
 34063                                          and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 34064                                          jmp     short set_done
 34065                                  not_off:
 34066                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 34067                                          stc
 34068                                          jne	short set_done	; no
 34069                                          or      byte [0417h],20h
 34070                                  set_done:
 34071                                          pop     ds
 34072                                          pop     ax
 34073                                          retn
 34074                                  
 34075                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34076                                  
 34077                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34078                                  ;
 34079                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 34080                                  ;
 34081                                  ;   INPUT
 34082                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 34083                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 34084                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 34085                                  ;
 34086                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34087                                  ;       Same as above;  the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 34088                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 34089                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 34090                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 34091                                  ;
 34092                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34093                                  ;       All
 34094                                  ;
 34095                                  ;   NOTES
 34096                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 34097                                  ;
 34098                                  ;   HISTORY
 34099                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 34100                                  ;
 34101                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34102                                  
 34103                                  menu_check:
 34104                                  
 34105                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present;  if so, then
 34106                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 34107                                  
 34108                                          push    cx              ;
 34109                                          push    si              ;
 34110                                          sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 34111                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 34112                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 34113                                          jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 34114                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 34115                                          jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 34116                                          inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 34117                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 34118                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 34119                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 34120                                          jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 34121                                          or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 34122                                          jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 34123                                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 34124                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 34125                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 34126                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 34127                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 34128                                          jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 34129                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 34130                                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 34131                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 34132                                          cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 34133                                          je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 34134                                          cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 34135                                          jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 34136                                          call    get_char        ;
 34137                                          and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 34138                                          cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 34139                                          jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 34140                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 34141                                          jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 34142                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 34143                                          cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 34144                                          jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 34145                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 34146                                          jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 34147                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 34148                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34149                                          jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 34150                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 34151                                          pop     si              ;
 34152                                          pop     cx              ;
 34153                                  
 34154                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 34155                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 34156                                  
 34157                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 34158                                          jnz	short menu_search
 34159                                  ;
 34160                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 34161                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 34162                                  ;
 34163                                          call    kbd_read
 34164                                          jnc	short menu_search
 34165                                          jmp	menu_abort
 34166                                  
 34167                                  ;   Search for MENU block;  it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 34168                                  
 34169                                  menu_search:
 34170                                          sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 34171                                          mov     di,szMenu	;
 34172                                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 34173                                          jnc	short menu_found ;
 34174                                          mov     byte [szBoot],0
 34175                                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 34176                                  
 34177                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 34178                                  
 34179                                  menu_color:
 34180                                          push    cx              ;
 34181                                          push    dx              ;
 34182                                          mov     dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 34183                                          call    get_number	; get first number
 34184                                          and     bl,0Fh		; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 34185                                          mov     ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 34186                                          and     dl,0F0h         ;
 34187                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 34188                                          call    delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 34189                                          jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 34190                                          call    get_number	; get next number
 34191                                          and     bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 34192                                          mov     dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 34193                                          and     dl,0Fh		;
 34194                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 34195                                          shl     bl,cl           ;
 34196                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 34197                                  check_color:                    ;
 34198                                          cmp     ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 34199                                          jne	short set_color	; no
 34200                                          xor     dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 34201                                  set_color:
 34202                                          mov     [bMenuColor],dl ;
 34203                                          pop     dx              ;
 34204                                          pop     cx              ;
 34205                                          jmp	menu_nextitem
 34206                                  
 34207                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 34208                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 34209                                  
 34210                                  menu_found:
 34211                                          mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 34212                                          mov     word [offDefBlock],0
 34213                                          mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 34214                                          and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 34215                                  
 34216                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 34217                                          sub     dx,dx           ; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 34218                                  
 34219                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 34220                                  
 34221                                  menu_process:
 34222                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 34223                                          jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 34224                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 34225                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 34226                                          je	short to_menu_getdefault
 34227                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 34228                                          je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 34229                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 34230                                          je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 34231                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 34232                                          je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 34233                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 34234                                          je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 34235                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 34236                                          je	short menu_numlock ;
 34237                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 34238                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 34239                                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 34240                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 34241                                          stc                     ;
 34242                                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 34243                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34244                                  menu_numlock:
 34245                                          call    set_numlock
 34246                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34247                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 34248                                          jmp     short menu_getdefault
 34249                                  
 34250                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 34251                                  
 34252                                  menu_default:
 34253                                          mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
